¶ Þanne ar ȝe cherles quod ich · and ȝowre children bothe
And sathan ȝowre saueoure · ȝow-selue now ȝe witnessen
For I haue saued ȝow-self seith cryst · and ȝowre sones after
Ȝowre bodyes ȝowre bestes · and blynde men holpen
And fedde ȝow with fisshes · and with fyue loues
And left baskettes ful of broke mete · bere awey who-so wolde
And mysseide þe iewes manliche and manaced hem to bete
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 And knokked on hem with a corde · and caste adown her stalles
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 Þat in cherche chaffareden · or chaungeden any moneye
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 And seyde it in siȝte of hem alle · so þat alle herden
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 I shal ouertourne þis temple · and adown throwe
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 And in thre dayes after · edifye it newe
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 And make it as moche other more · in alle manere poyntes
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 As euere it was and as wyde · wher-fore I hote ȝow
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 Of preyeres and of parfitnesse · þis place þat ȝe callen
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 Mat.xxi.Cr2.16.142 Mat.xxi.Cr3.16.141 Domus mea domus oracionis vocabitur
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 Mat.xxi.Cr2.16.142 Mat.xxi.Cr3.16.141 Enuye and yuel wille · was in þe iewes
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 Mat.xxi.Cr2.16.142 Mat.xxi.Cr3.16.141 Thei casten & contreueden · to kulle hym whan þei miȝte
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 Mat.xxi.Cr2.16.142 Mat.xxi.Cr3.16.141 Vche daye after other · þeire tyme þei awaited
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 Mat.xxi.Cr2.16.142 Mat.xxi.Cr3.16.141 Til it bifel on a fryday · a litel bifor Paske
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 Mat.xxi.Cr2.16.142 Mat.xxi.Cr3.16.141 Þe þorsday byfore þere he made his maundee
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 Mat.xxi.Cr2.16.142 Mat.xxi.Cr3.16.141 Sittyng atte sopere · he seide þise wordes
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 Mat.xxi.Cr2.16.142 Mat.xxi.Cr3.16.141 · nota · C16.111 I am solde þorw one of ȝow · he shal þe tyme rewe
# Fugacionem Iudeorum de TemploM16.134 Mat.xxi.Cr2.16.142 Mat.xxi.Cr3.16.141 · nota · C16.111 Þat euere he his saueoure solde · for syluer or elles

¶ Iudas iangeled þere-aȝein · ac Ihesus hym tolde
It was hym[self] sothely · and seide tu dicis
The maner of Iudas betrayng is vsedCr3.16.152 Þanne went forth þat wikked man · and with þe iewes mette
The maner of Iudas betrayng is vsedCr3.16.152 And tolde hem a tokne how to knowe with ihesus
The maner of Iudas betrayng is vsedCr3.16.152 And which tokne to þis day · to moche is yvsed
The maner of Iudas betrayng is vsedCr3.16.152 Þat is kissyng and faire contenaunce · & vnkynde wille
The maner of Iudas betrayng is vsedCr3.16.152 And so was with iudas þo · þat Ihesus bytrayed
The maner of Iudas betrayng is vsedCr3.16.152 Aue raby quod þat ribaude · and riȝt to hym he ȝede
The maner of Iudas betrayng is vsedCr3.16.152 # quomodo Iudas tradidit CristumM16.159 And kiste hym to be cauȝt þere-by · and kulled of þe iewes

¶ Þanne Ihesus to Iudas · and to þe iewes seyde
Falsenesse I fynde · in þi faire speche
And gyle in þi gladde chere · and galle is in þi lawghyng
Mat.xviii.Cr2.16.163 Þow shalt be myroure to manye men to deceyue
Mat.xviii.Cr2.16.163 Ac þe wors and þi wikkednesse · shal worth vpon þi-selue
Mat.xviii.Cr2.16.163 Mat.18.Cr3.16.164 Necesse est vt veniant scandala · ve homini illi per quem scandalum venit
Mat.xviii.Cr2.16.163 Mat.18.Cr3.16.164 Þow I bi tresoun be ytake · at ȝowre owne wille
Mat.xviii.Cr2.16.163 Mat.18.Cr3.16.164 Suffreth my postles in pays · & in pees gange
Mat.xviii.Cr2.16.163 Mat.18.Cr3.16.164 On a thoresday in thesternesse · þus was he taken
Mat.xviii.Cr2.16.163 Mat.18.Cr3.16.164 Þorw iudas and iewes · ihesus was his name
Mat.xviii.Cr2.16.163 Mat.18.Cr3.16.164 Þat on þe fryday folwynge · for mankynde sake
Mat.xviii.Cr2.16.163 Mat.18.Cr3.16.164 Iusted in ierusalem · a ioye to vs alle
Mat.xviii.Cr2.16.163 Mat.18.Cr3.16.164 On crosse vpon caluarye · cryst toke þe bataille
Mat.xviii.Cr2.16.163 Mat.18.Cr3.16.164 Aȝeines deth and þe deuel · destruyed her botheres myȝtes
Mat.xviii.Cr2.16.163 Mat.18.Cr3.16.164 Deyde and deth fordid · and daye of nyȝte made

¶ And I awaked þere-with · & wyped myne eyghen
And after piers þe plowman · pryed and stared
Estwarde and westwarde · I awayted after faste
And ȝede forth as an ydiote · in contre to aspye
After Pieres þe plowman · many a place I souȝte
[scroll-like pattern]G17.178, extends downwards for approximately 7 lines. And þanne mette I with a man · a mydlenten sondaye
[scroll-like pattern]G17.178, extends downwards for approximately 7 lines. As hore as an hawethorne · and Abraham he hiȝte
[scroll-like pattern]G17.178, extends downwards for approximately 7 lines. I frayned hym first · fram whennes he come
[scroll-like pattern]G17.178, extends downwards for approximately 7 lines. John SympsonR16.183. Between R16.183-184 (KD16.175-176), between two verse paragraphs, a sixteenth-century (secretary) pen trial, mostly erased. And of whennes he were · and whider þat he þouȝte

¶ I am feith quod þat freke · it falleth nouȝte to lye
# de FideM16.185 And of Abrahames hous · an heraud of armes
# de FideM16.185 I seke after a segge · þat I seigh ones
# de FideM16.185 A ful bolde bacheler · I knewe hym by his blasen

What bereth þat buirn quod I þo · so blisse þe bityde

All of the pen trials appear to be in the same hand, but the different shades of ink and variations in cut of the stylus suggest that they were executed at different times. NotaM16.220 Psal xxii.Cr2.16.222 Psal.xxiiCr3.16.221 · Nota · C16.186 XL16.225 Nota [E-like symbol]R16.225, 15th century hand AbrahamM16.235 knakR16.238, 15th century hand Abraham is circumcised,Cr3.16.244 Wyll NDR16.246, secretary hand +L16.261 Seyde þat he seigh here · þat sholde saue vs alle
NotaM16.220 Psal xxii.Cr2.16.222 Psal.xxiiCr3.16.221 · Nota · C16.186 XL16.225 Nota [E-like symbol]R16.225, 15th century hand AbrahamM16.235 knakR16.238, 15th century hand Abraham is circumcised,Cr3.16.244 Wyll NDR16.246, secretary hand +L16.261 Iohn.iCr2.16.263 Iohn.i,Cr3.16.262 Ecce agnus dei &c ·

¶ I hadde wonder of his wordes · and of his wyde clothes
For in his bosome he bar a thyng · þat he blissed euere
And I loked on his lappe · a lazar lay þere-Inne
Amonges patriarkes and profetes · pleyande togyderes
What awaytestow quod he · and what woldestow haue
I wolde wyte quod I þo what is in ȝowre lappe

¶ Loo quod he and lete me se · lorde mercy I seide
Þis is present of moche prys · what Prynce shal it haue

It is a preciouse present quod he · ac þe pouke it hath attached
And me þere-myde quod þat man · may no wedde vs quite
Ne no buyrn be owre borwgh · ne bryng vs fram his daungere
Oute of þe poukes pondfolde · no meynprise may vs fecche
Tyl he come þat I carpe of · cryst is his name
Þat shal delyure vs some daye · out of þe deueles powere
And bettere wedde for vs legge · þan we ben alle worthy
Þat is lyf for lyf · or ligge þus euere
Lollynge in my lappe · tyl such a lorde vs fecche

¶ Allas I seyde þat synne · so longe shal lette
Þe myȝte of goddes mercy · þat myȝt vs alle amende
I wepte for his wordes · with þat sawe I an other
Rapelich renne forth · þe riȝte waye he went
I affrayned hym fyrste · fram whennes he come
And what he hiȝte & whider he wolde · and wightlich he tolde

Passus septimus decimus


I am spes quod he a spye · and spire after a knyȝte
That toke me a maundement vpon þe mounte of synay
To reule alle rewmes with · I bere þe writte here
Is it asseled I seyde · may men se þi lettres
Nay he sayde I seke hym · þat hath þe sele to kepe
¶ And þat is crosse and crystenedome · and cryst þere-on to hange
And whan it is asseled so · I wote wel þe sothe
Þat Lucyferes lordeship · laste shal no lenger
Late se þi lettres quod I · we miȝte þe lawe knowe

¶ Þanne plokked he forth a patent · a pece of an harde roche
Mat.xxiiCr2.17.11 Wher-on was writen two wordes · on þis wyse yglosed
Mat.xxiiCr2.17.11 Mat.xxiiCr3.17.12 Dilige deum & proximum tuum &c
Mat.xxiiCr2.17.11 Mat.xxiiCr3.17.12 Þis was þe tixte trewly · I toke ful gode ȝeme
Mat.xxiiCr2.17.11 Mat.xxiiCr3.17.12 Þe glose was gloriousely writen · with a gilte penne
Mat.xxiiCr2.17.11 Mat.xxiiCr3.17.12 In hijs duobus mandatis tota lex pendet & prophetia

¶ Is here alle þi lordes lawes quod I · ȝe leue me wel he seyde
And who-so worcheth after þis writte · I wil vndertaken
Shal neuere deuel hym dere · ne deth in soule greue
For þough I seye it my-self · I haue saued with þis charme
Of men & of wommen · many score þousandes

¶ He seith soth seyde þis heraud · I haue yfounde it ofte
Lo here in my lappe · þat leued on þat charme
Iosue and Iudith · and Iudas Macabeus
Ȝe and sexty þousande bisyde-forth · þat ben nouȝt seyen here

¶ Ȝowre wordes aren wonderful quod I tho · which of ȝow is trewest
In quemM17.26 And lelest to leue on · for lyf and for soule
In quemM17.26 Tres vidit vnum adorauitM17.27 Abraham seith þat he seigh · holy þe Trinite
In quemM17.26 Tres vidit vnum adorauitM17.27 Abraham saw thre distincte persons in trinityCr3.17.28 Thre persones in parcelles · departable fro other
In quemM17.26 Tres vidit vnum adorauitM17.27 Abraham saw thre distincte persons in trinityCr3.17.28 And alle þre but o god · þus abraham me tauȝte
In quemM17.26 Tres vidit vnum adorauitM17.27 Abraham saw thre distincte persons in trinityCr3.17.28 And hath saued þat bileued so · and sory for her synnes
In quemM17.26 Tres vidit vnum adorauitM17.27 Abraham saw thre distincte persons in trinityCr3.17.28 He can nouȝte segge þe somme · and some aren in his lappe
In quemM17.26 Tres vidit vnum adorauitM17.27 Abraham saw thre distincte persons in trinityCr3.17.28 What neded it þanne · a newe lawe to bigynne
In quemM17.26 Tres vidit vnum adorauitM17.27 Abraham saw thre distincte persons in trinityCr3.17.28 Sith þe fyrst sufficeth · to sauacioun & to blisse

¶ And now cometh spes and speketh · þat hath aspied þe lawe
And telleth nouȝte of þe Trinitee · þat toke hym his lettres
To byleue and louye · in o lorde almyȝty
And sitthe riȝt as my-self · so louye alle peple

XM17.38 ¶ Þe gome þat goth with o staf · he semeth in gretter hele
XM17.38 Þan he þat goth with two staues · to syȝte of vs alle
XM17.38 And riȝte so by þe Rode · resoun me sheweth
XM17.38 It is lyȝter to lewed men · a lessoun to knowe
XM17.38 Þan for to techen hem two · and to harde to lerne þe leest
XM17.38 It is ful harde for any man · on abraham byleue
XM17.38 And welawey worse ȝit · for to loue a shrewe
XM17.38 It is liȝtor to leue · in þre louely persones
XM17.38 Þan for to louye and lene · as wel lorelles as lele
XM17.38 Go þi gate quod I to spes · so me god helpe
XM17.38 Þo þat lerneth þi lawe · wil litel while vsen it

And as we wenten þus in þe weye · wordyng togyderes
Þanne seye we a samaritan · sittende on a mule
Rydynge ful rapely · þe riȝt weye we ȝeden
Comynge fro a cuntre · þat men called Ierico
id est cristusBx17.54: id est cristus: This is written in the margin by the main hand in LM, and at the end of the line in R. Hm has it in the margin in another hand. To a iustes in iherusalem · he chaced awey faste

CristusM17.54 The man wounded of theuesCr3.17.55 = C17.57 And as naked as a nedle · and none helpe aboute hym

¶ Feith had first siȝte of hym · ac he flegh on syde
And nolde nouȝt neighen hym · by nyne londes lengthe

¶ Hope cam hippyng after · þat hadde so ybosted
How he with Moyses maundement · hadde many men yholpe
- C17.63 Ac whan he hadde siȝte of þat segge · a-syde he gan hym drawe
- C17.63 Dredfully by þis day as duk · doth fram þe faucoun

¶ Ac so sone so þe samaritan · hadde siȝte of þis lede
He liȝte adown of lyard · and ladde hym in his hande
And to þe wye he went · his woundes to biholde
And parceyued bi his pous · he was in peril to deye
And but if he hadde recourere · þe rather ; þat rise shulde he neure
Wyth wyn & with oyle · his woundes he wasshed
Enbawmed hym and bonde his hed · & in his lappe hym layde
And ladde hym so forth on lyard · to lex cristi a graunge
Wel six myle or seuene · biside þe newe market
Herberwed hym at an hostrye · and to þe hostellere called
And sayde haue kepe þis man · til I come fro þe iustes
And lo here syluer he seyde · for salue to his woundes
And he toke hym two pans · to lyflode as it were
And seide what he speneth more · I make þe good hereafter
- C17.79 For I may nouȝt lette quod þat leode · & lyarde he bistrydeth
- C17.79 And raped hym to iherusalem-ward · þe riȝte waye to ryde

¶ Faith folweth after faste · and fonded to mete hym
And spes spaklich hym spedde · spede if he myȝte
To ouertake hym and talke to hym · ar þei to toun come

¶ And whan I seyȝ þis I soiourned nouȝte · but shope me to renne
And suwed þat samaritan · þat was so ful of pite
And graunted hym to ben his grome · gramercy he seyde
Ac þi frende and þi felawe quod he · þow fyndest me at nede

Pierce orifereth Christ to be come his seruantCr3.17.88 ¶ And I thanked hym þo · and sith I hym tolde
Pierce orifereth Christ to be come his seruantCr3.17.88 How þat feith fleigh awey · and spes his felaw bothe
Pierce orifereth Christ to be come his seruantCr3.17.88 For siȝte of þe sorweful man · þat robbed was with þeues

Haue hem excused quod he · her help may litel auaille
May no medcyn on molde · þe man to hele brynge
Neither feith ne fyn hope · so festred ben his woundis
With-out þe blode of a barn · borne of a mayde
And be he bathed in þat blode · baptised as it were
And þanne plastred with penaunce · and passioun of þat babi
He shulde stonde and steppe · ac stalworth worth he neure
Tyl he haue eten al þe barn · and his blode ydronke
+L17.99 For went neuere wy in þis worlde þorw þat wildernesse
+L17.99 Þat he ne was robbed or rifled · rode he þere or ȝede
+L17.99 Saue faith & his felaw · spes and my-selue
+L17.99 And þi-self now · and such as suwen owre werkis

¶ For outlawes in þe wode · and vnder banke lotyeth
And may vch man se · and gode merke take
Who is bihynde and who bifore · and who ben on hors
For he halt hym hardyer on horse · þan he þat is a-fote
For he seigh me þat am samaritan · suwen feith & his felaw
On my caple þat hatte caro · of mankynde I toke it
He was vnhardy þat harlot · and hudde hym in inferno
Ac ar þis day þre dayes · I dar vndertaken
Þat he worth fettred þat feloune · fast with cheynes
And neure eft greue grome · þat goth þis ilke gate

¶ And þanne shal feith be forester here · and in þis fritth walke
And kennen out comune men · þat knoweth nouȝte þe contre
Which is þe weye þat ich went · and wherforth to iherusalem
And hope þe hostelleres man shal be · þere þe man lith an helynge
And alle þat fieble and faynt be · þat faith may nouȝt teche
Hope shal lede hem forth with loue · as his lettre telleth
And hostel hem and hele · þorw holicherche bileue
Of Christes resurrection,Cr3.17.120 Tyl I haue salue for alle syke · and þanne shal I retourne
Of Christes resurrection,Cr3.17.120 And come aȝein bi þis contree · and confort alle syke
Of Christes resurrection,Cr3.17.120 Þat craueth it or coueiteth it · and cryeth þere-after
Of Christes resurrection,Cr3.17.120 For þe barne was born in bethleem · þat with his blode shal saue
Of Christes resurrection,Cr3.17.120 Alle þat lyueth in faith · and folweth his felawes techynge

¶ A swete syre I seyde þo · wher I shal byleue
| C17.127 As feith and his felawe · enfourmed me bothe
| C17.127 In þre persones departable · þat perpetuel were euere
| C17.127 And alle þre but o god · þus abraham me tauȝte
| C17.127 And hope afterwarde · he bad me to louye
| C17.127 O god wyth al my good · and alle gomes after
| C17.127 Louye hem lyke my-selue · ac owre lorde aboue alle

¶ After abraham quod he · þat heraud of armes
Sette faste þi faith · and ferme bileue
And as hope hiȝte þe · I hote þat þow louye
Thyn euene-crystene euermore · euene-forth with þi-self
And if conscience carpe þere-aȝein · or kynde witte oyther
Ostende manum quia deus assimulatur ad manumM17.137 Or heretykes with argumentz · þin honde þow hym shewe
Ostende manum quia deus assimulatur ad manumM17.137 The triniti lyke an handeCr3.17.138 For god is after an hande · yhere now and knowe it

¶ Þe fader was fyrst as a fyst · with o fynger foldynge
Tyl hym loued and lest · to vnlosen his fynger
And profre it forth as with a paume · to what place it sholde
Þe paume is purely þe hande · and profreth forth þe fyngres
To mynystre and to make · þat myȝte of hande knoweth
And bitokneth trewly · telle who-so liketh
Þe holygost of heuene · he is as þe paume
Þe fyngres þat fre ben · to folde and to serue
Bitokneth sothly þe sone · þat sent was til erthe
Þat toched and tasted · atte techynge of þe paume
Seynt Marie a Mayde · and mankynde lauȝte
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 Qui conceptus est de spiritu sancto &c
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 Þe fader is þanne as a fust · with fynger to touche
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 Quia omnia traham ad me ipsum &c
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 Al þat þe paume parceyueth · profitable to fele
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 Thus ar þei alle but one · as it an hande were
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 And þre sondry siȝtes · in one shewynge
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 Þe paume for he putteth forth fyngres and þe fust bothe
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 Riȝt so redily · reson it sheweth
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 How he þat is holygoste · sire & sone preueth
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 And as þe hande halt harde · and al þynge faste
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 Þorw foure fyngres and a thombe · forth with þe paume
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 Riȝte so þe fader and þe sone · & seynt spirit þe þridde
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 Halt al þe wyde worlde · with-in hem thre
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 Bothe welkne and þe wynde · water and erthe
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 Heuene & helle · and al þat þere is Inne
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 Þus it is · nedeth no man · to trowe non other
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 That thre þinges bilongeth · in owre lorde of heuene
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 - C17.165 + + And aren serelepes by hem-self · asondry were neure
Iohn.xiCr2.17.150 ?Cr3.17.151 - C17.165 + + Namore þan myn hande may meue with-outen fyngeres

¶ And as my fust is ful honde · yfolde togideres
So is þe fader a ful god · formeour and shepper
Tu fabricator omnium &c
The Trinitye lyke an hand,Cr3.17.170 And al þe myȝte myd hym is in makyng of þynges

¶ The fyngres fourrmen a ful hande · to purtreye or peynten
Keruynge and compassynge · as crafte of þe fyngres
Riȝt so is þe sone · þe science of þe fader
And ful god as is þe fader · no febler ne no better

# discripcionem trinitatis ad similitudinem manusM17.177 Otherwyse þan þe wrythen fuste or werkmanschip of fyngres
# discripcionem trinitatis ad similitudinem manusM17.177 For þe paume hath powere to put oute alle þe ioyntes

# discripcionem trinitatis ad similitudinem manusM17.177 - C17.178. This line in C combines KD17.179 and 181. For peyne of þe paume ; powere hem failleth
# discripcionem trinitatis ad similitudinem manusM17.177 - C17.178. This line in C combines KD17.179 and 181. To clicche or to clawe · to clyppe or to holde

¶ Were þe myddel of myn honde · ymaymed or ypersshed
I shulde receyue riȝte nouȝte · of þat I reche myȝte
Ac þough my thombe & my fyngres bothe were to-shullen
And þe myddel of myn hande · with-oute male-ese
In many kynnes maneres · I myȝte my-self helpe
Bothe meue and amende · þough alle my fyngres oke
# de peccato contra spiritum sanctumM17.197 Bi þis skil me þynke · I se an euydence
# de peccato contra spiritum sanctumM17.197 Þat who-so synneth in þe seynt spirit assoilled worth he neure
# de peccato contra spiritum sanctumM17.197 Noither here ne elles-where · as I herde telle
# de peccato contra spiritum sanctumM17.197 Mat.xii,Cr3.17.198 Qui peccat in spiritu sancto &c
# de peccato contra spiritum sanctumM17.197 Mat.xii,Cr3.17.198 For he prikketh god as in þe paume · þat peccat in spiritu sancto
# de peccato contra spiritum sanctumM17.197 Mat.xii,Cr3.17.198 math.xii. For god þe fader is as a fuste þe sone is as a fynger
# de peccato contra spiritum sanctumM17.197 Mat.xii,Cr3.17.198 math.xii. The holy goste of heuene · is as it were þe pawme
# de peccato contra spiritum sanctumM17.197 Mat.xii,Cr3.17.198 math.xii. So who-so synneth in seynt spirit · it semeth þat he greueth
# de peccato contra spiritum sanctumM17.197 Mat.xii,Cr3.17.198 math.xii. God þat he grypeth with · and wolde his grace quenche

The Trinytie is ly-koned to a torcheor a taporC2.17.204 nota # Aliam discripcionem trinitatis ad similitudinem Candeli ¶ And to a torche or a tapre · þe trinitee is lykned

The Trinytie is ly-koned to a torcheor a taporC2.17.204 nota # Aliam discripcionem trinitatis ad similitudinem Candeli The holy gost shew so by simulitudsCr3.17.210 ~ C17.209 Lele loue other lyf · þat owre lorde shapte

¶ And as glowande gledes · gladieth nouȝte þis werkmen
Þat worchen & waken in wyntres niȝtes
As doth a kex or a candel · þat cauȝte hath fyre & blaseth
Namore doth sire ne sone · ne seynt spirit togyderes
Graunteth no grace · ne forȝifnesse of synnes
Til þe holi goste gynne · to glowe and to blase
So þat þe holygoste · gloweth but as a glede
Tyl þat lele loue · ligge on hym & blowe
And þanne flaumbeth he as fyre on fader & on filius
And melteth her myȝte in-to mercy · as men may se in wyntre
Ysekeles in eueses þorw hete of þe sonne
Melteth in a mynut-while · to myst & to watre
So grace of þe holygoste · þe grete myȝte of þe trinite
Melteth in-to mercy · to mercyable & to non other
And as wex with-outen more · on a warme glede
Wil brennen & blasen · be þei to-gyderes
And solacen hem þat may se · þat sitten in derkenesse
So wole þe fader forȝif folke of mylde hertes
Þat reufulliche repenten · & restitucioun make
In as moche as þei mowen · amenden & payen
[vertical script, different hand, the length of page.]S17.236 And if it suffice nouȝte for assetz · þat in suche a wille deyeth
[vertical script, different hand, the length of page.]S17.236 Mercy for his mekenesse · wil make good þe remenaunte
[vertical script, different hand, the length of page.]S17.236 And as þe weyke and fyre · wil make a warme flaumbe
[vertical script, different hand, the length of page.]S17.236 For to myrthe men with · þat in merke sitten
[vertical script, different hand, the length of page.]S17.236 # de gratitudine Cristi bene loquiturM17.244 So wil cryst of his curteisye · and men crye hym mercy
[vertical script, different hand, the length of page.]S17.236 # de gratitudine Cristi bene loquiturM17.244 Bothe forȝiue & forȝete · & ȝet bidde for vs
[vertical script, different hand, the length of page.]S17.236 # de gratitudine Cristi bene loquiturM17.244 To þe fader of heuene · forȝyuenesse to haue

¶ Ac hew fyre at a flynte · fowre hundreth wyntre
Bot þow haue towe to take it with · tondre or broches
Al þi laboure is loste · and al þi longe trauaille
For may no fyre flaumbe make · faille it his kynde
So is þe holy gost god · & grace with-outen mercy
To alle vnkynde creatures · cryst hym-self witnesseth
Math. xxvCr2.17.253 Mat.xxvCr3.17.250 Amen dico vobis nescio vos &c ·

# de Ingratidtudine bene loquitur ¶ Be vnkynde to þin euene-cristene · and al þat þow canst bidden

notaL17.334 ¶ Þise thre þat I telle of · ben þus to vnderstonde
notaL17.334 vxorL17.335 The wyf is owre wikked flesshe · þat wil nouȝt be chasted
notaL17.334 vxorL17.335 For kynde cleueth on hym euere · to contrarie þe soule
notaL17.334 vxorL17.335 And þowgh it falle it fynt skiles · þe frelete it made
notaL17.334 vxorL17.335 And þat is liȝtly forȝeuen · and forȝeten bothe
notaL17.334 vxorL17.335 stillicidaL17.339 To man þat mercy asketh · and amende þenketh

notaL17.340 ¶ The reyne þat reyneth · þere we reste sholde
notaL17.340 Ben sikenesses & sorwes · þat we suffren oft
notaL17.340 As Powle þe Apostle · to þe peple tauȝte
notaL17.340 ii.Cor.xii.Cr2.17.343 ii.Cor.xiiCr3.17.340 Virtus in infirmitate perficitur &c ·
notaL17.340 ii.Cor.xii.Cr2.17.343 ii.Cor.xiiCr3.17.340 And þowgh þat men make ; moche deol in her angre
notaL17.340 ii.Cor.xii.Cr2.17.343 ii.Cor.xiiCr3.17.340 And inpacient in here penaunce · pure resoun knoweth
notaL17.340 ii.Cor.xii.Cr2.17.343 ii.Cor.xiiCr3.17.340 # pro hijs qui male possunt patiM17.346 Þat þei han cause to contrarie · by kynde of her sykenesse
notaL17.340 ii.Cor.xii.Cr2.17.343 ii.Cor.xiiCr3.17.340 # pro hijs qui male possunt patiM17.346 And liȝtlich owre lorde · at her lyues ende
notaL17.340 ii.Cor.xii.Cr2.17.343 ii.Cor.xiiCr3.17.340 # pro hijs qui male possunt patiM17.346 Hath mercy on suche men · þat so yuel may suffre

¶ Ac þe smoke and þe smolder þat smyt in owre eyghen
Þat is coueityse and vnkyndenesse · þat quencheth goddes mercy
For vnkyndenesse is þe contrarie · of alkynnes resoun
fumusL17.352 For þere nys syke ne sori · ne non so moche wrecche
fumusL17.352 Þat he ne may louye & hym lyke · and lene of his herte
fumusL17.352 Goed wille & good worde ; bothe wisshen and willen
fumusL17.352 Alle manere men · mercy & forȝifnesse
fumusL17.352 And louye hem liche hym-self · and his lyf amende
fumusL17.352 I may no lenger lette quod he · and lyarde he pryked
fumusL17.352 IC2.17.355 And went away as wynde · and þere-with I awaked

Passus duodevicesimus


de passione Cristi Wolleward and wete-shoed · went I forth after
de passione Cristi As a reccheles renke · þat of no wo reccheth
de passione Cristi And ȝede forth lyke a lorel · al my lyf-tyme
de passione Cristi | Tyl I wex wery of þe worlde · and wylned eft to slepe
de passione Cristi | And lened me to a lenten · and longe tyme I slepte
de passione Cristi | And of crystes passioun and penaunce · þe peple þat of-rauȝte
de passione Cristi | Rested me þere and rutte faste · tyl ramis palmarum
de passione Cristi | Of gerlis & of gloria laus · gretly me dremed
de passione Cristi | And how osanna by orgonye · olde folke songen

- ¶ One semblable to þe samaritan · & some-del to Piers þe plowman
- Barfote on an asse bakke · botelees cam pryke
- Wyth-oute spores other spere · spakliche he loked
- As is þe kynde of a knyȝte · þat cometh to be dubbed
- To geten hem gylte spores · or galoches ycouped

¶ Þanne was faith in a fenestre · and cryde a fili dauid
As doth an Heraude of armes · whan aunturos cometh to iustes
Olde iuwes of ierusalem · for ioye þei songen
Math.xxiCr2.18.18 Mat.xxi.Cr3.18.18 Benedictus qui venit in nomine domini

¶ Þanne I frayned at faith · what al þat fare be-ment
+L18.20 And who sholde iouste in Iherusalem · Ihesus he seyde
+L18.20 And fecche þat þe fende claymeth · Piers fruit þe plowman
+L18.20 Is Piers in þis place quod I · & he preynte on me
+L18.20 Þis Ihesus of his gentrice · wole iuste in piers armes
+L18.20 In his helme & in his haberioun · humana natura
+L18.20 Þat cryst be nouȝt biknowe here · for consumatus deus
+L18.20 memorandumO17.26. A rubricated dot precedes "memorandum," but at such a distance from it that it does not seem to punctuate it. In Piers paltok þe plowman · þis priker shal ryde
+L18.20 memorandumO17.26. A rubricated dot precedes "memorandum," but at such a distance from it that it does not seem to punctuate it. For no dynte shal hym dere · as in deitate patris
+L18.20 memorandumO17.26. A rubricated dot precedes "memorandum," but at such a distance from it that it does not seem to punctuate it. Who shal iuste with Ihesus quod I iuwes or scribes

¶ Nay quod he þe foule fende · and fals dome & deth
Deth seith he shal fordo · and adown brynge
argumentt G19.31 Al þat lyueth or loketh · in londe or in watere
argumentt G19.31 off lyf & G19.32 Lyf seyth þat he likthe · and leyth his lif to wedde
argumentt G19.31 off lyf & G19.32 detheG9.33 Þat for al þat deth can do · with-in þre dayes
argumentt G19.31 off lyf & G19.32 detheG9.33 To walke and fecche fro þe fende · piers fruite þe plowman
argumentt G19.31 off lyf & G19.32 detheG9.33 And legge it þere hym lyketh · and lucifer bynde
argumentt G19.31 off lyf & G19.32 detheG9.33 And forbete and adown brynge bale deth for euere
argumentt G19.31 off lyf & G19.32 detheG9.33 O mors ero mors tua

Ozech.xiii.Cr2.18.38 Ozee.xiiiCr3.18.38 ¶ Þanne cam pilatus with moche peple · sedens pro tribunali
Ozech.xiii.Cr2.18.38 Ozee.xiiiCr3.18.38 To se how doughtilich deth sholde do · & deme her botheres riȝte
Ozech.xiii.Cr2.18.38 Ozee.xiiiCr3.18.38 Þe iuwes and þe iustice · aȝeine Ihesu þei were
Ozech.xiii.Cr2.18.38 Ozee.xiiiCr3.18.38 And al her courte on hym cryde · crucifige sharpe
Ozech.xiii.Cr2.18.38 Ozee.xiiiCr3.18.38 Tho put hym forth a piloure · bifor pilat & seyde
Ozech.xiii.Cr2.18.38 Ozee.xiiiCr3.18.38 This ihesus of owre iewes temple · iaped & dispised
Ozech.xiii.Cr2.18.38 Ozee.xiiiCr3.18.38 To fordone it on o day · and in thre dayes after
Ozech.xiii.Cr2.18.38 Ozee.xiiiCr3.18.38 Edefye it eft newe · here he stant þat seyde it
Ozech.xiii.Cr2.18.38 Ozee.xiiiCr3.18.38 And ȝit maken it as moche · in al manere poyntes
Ozech.xiii.Cr2.18.38 Ozee.xiiiCr3.18.38 Bothe as longe and as large · bi loft & by grounde

¶ Cru[ci]fige quod a cacchepolle · I warante hym a wicche
Iohn.xixCr2.18.49 Iohn.xixCr3.18.49 Tolle tolle quod an other · and toke o kene þornes
Iohn.xixCr2.18.49 Iohn.xixCr3.18.49 And bigan of kene thorne · a gerelande to make
Iohn.xixCr2.18.49 Iohn.xixCr3.18.49 And sette it sore on his hed · and seyde in envye
Iohn.xixCr2.18.49 Iohn.xixCr3.18.49 Aue rabby quod þat Ribaude · and þrew redes at hym
Iohn.xixCr2.18.49 Iohn.xixCr3.18.49 foureR18.53 Nailled hym with þre nailles · naked on þe Rode
Iohn.xixCr2.18.49 Iohn.xixCr3.18.49 foureR18.53 And poysoun on a pole · þei put vp to his lippes
Iohn.xixCr2.18.49 Iohn.xixCr3.18.49 foureR18.53 And bede hym drynke his deth yuel · his dayes were ydone
Iohn.xixCr2.18.49 Iohn.xixCr3.18.49 foureR18.53 And ȝif þat þow sotil be · help now þi-seluen
Iohn.xixCr2.18.49 Iohn.xixCr3.18.49 foureR18.53 If þow be cryst & kynges sone · come downe of þe Rode
Iohn.xixCr2.18.49 Iohn.xixCr3.18.49 foureR18.53 Þanne shul we leue þat lyf þe loueth · and wil nouȝt lete þe deye

¶ Consummatum est quod cryst · & comsed forto swowe
Pitousliche and pale · as a prisoun þat deyeth
Þe lorde of lyf & of liȝte · þo leyed his eyen togideres
Þe daye for drede with-drowe · and derke bicam þe sonne
Þe wal wagged and clef and al þe worlde quaued
Ded men for that dyne · come out of depe graues
And tolde whi þat tempest · so longe tyme dured
For a bitter bataille · þe ded bodye sayde
Lyf and deth in þis derknesse · her one fordoth her other
Shal no wiȝte wite witterly who shal haue þe maystrye
Er sondey aboute sonne rysynge · & sank with þat til erthe
Some seyde þat he was goddes sone · þat so faire deyde
Mar.xvCr3.18.71 Vere filius dei erat iste · &c
Mar.xvCr3.18.71 Math.xvCr2.18.72 And somme saide he was a wicche · good is þat we assaye
Mar.xvCr3.18.71 Math.xvCr2.18.72 Where he be ded or nouȝte ded · doun er he be taken

¶ Two theues also · tholed deth þat tyme
Vppon a crosse bisydes cryst · so was þe comune lawe
A cacchepole cam forth · and craked bothe her legges
And her armes after · of eyther of þo theues
Ac was no boy so bolde · goddes body to touche
For he was knyȝte & kynges sone · kynde forȝaf þat tyme
Þat non harlot were so hardy · to leyne hande vppon hym

notaL17.81, musical pun. ¶ Ac þere cam forth a knyȝte · with a kene spere ygrounde
notaL17.81, musical pun. He citeth a lye out of the Legendandi[?]Cr3.18.82 XM18.82 Hiȝte longeus as þe lettre telleth · and longe had lore his siȝte

notaL17.81, musical pun. He citeth a lye out of the Legendandi[?]Cr3.18.82 XM18.82 Haue on me reuth riȝtful ihesu · & riȝt with þat he wept

¶ Thanne gan faith felly · þe fals iuwes dispise
Called hem caytyues · acursed for euere
For þis foule vyleynye · veniaunce to ȝow alle
To do þe blynde bete hym ybounde · it was a boyes conseille
Cursed caytyue · kniȝthod was it neuere
To mysdo a ded body · by day or by nyȝte
Þe gree ȝit hath he geten · for al his grete wounde

¶ For ȝowre champioun chiualer chief knyȝt of ȝow alle
Ȝelt hym recreaunt rennyng · riȝt at ihesus wille
For be þis derkenesse ydo · his deth worth avenged
And ȝe lordeynes han ylost · for lyf shal haue þe maistrye
And ȝowre Fraunchise þat fre was · fallen is in thraldome
And ȝe cherles & ȝowre children · chieue shal ȝe neure
Ne haue lordship in londe · ne no londe tylye
The lord accurseth vsurersCr3.18.109 But al bareyne be · & vsurye vsen
The lord accurseth vsurersCr3.18.109 Which is lyf þat owre lorde · in alle lawes acurseth
The lord accurseth vsurersCr3.18.109 Now ȝowre good dayes ar done · as Danyel prophecyed
The lord accurseth vsurersCr3.18.109 +L17.112 Whan cryst cam · her kyngdom · þe croune shulde [cesse]

Dani.ix.Cr3.18.113 ¶ What for fere of þis ferly · & of þe fals iuwes

¶ Her suster as it semed · cam softly walkyng
Euene out of þe est · and westward she loked
VeritasC2.18.123 A ful comely creature · treuth she hiȝte
VeritasC2.18.123 For þe vertue þat hir folwed · aferd was she neuere

¶ Whan þis maydenes mette · mercy and treuth
Eyther axed other · of þis grete wonder
Of þe dyne & of þe derknesse · and how þe daye rowed
And which a liȝte and a leme · lay befor helle
Veritas .O18.129 Ich haue ferly of þis fare · in feith seyde treuth
Veritas .O18.129 And am wendyng to wyte · what þis wonder meneth

Misericordia.O18.131 ¶ Haue no merueille quod mercy · myrthe it bytokneth
Misericordia.O18.131 A mayden þat hatte marye · and moder with-out felyng
Misericordia.O18.131 Of any kynnes creature · conceyued þorw speche
Misericordia.O18.131 And grace of þe holygoste · wex grete with childe
Misericordia.O18.131 With-outen wem · in-to þis worlde she brouȝt hym
Misericordia.O18.131 And þat my tale be trewe · I take god to witnesse
Misericordia.O18.131 Sith þis barn was bore · ben xxx wynter passed
Misericordia.O18.131 Which deyde & deth þoled · þis day aboute mydday
Misericordia.O18.131 And þat is cause of þis clips · þat closeth now þe sonne
Misericordia.O18.131 In menynge þat man shal · fro merkenesse be drawe
Misericordia.O18.131 Þe while þis liȝte & þis leme · shal Lucyfer ablende
Misericordia.O18.131 For patriarkes & prophetes · han preched her-of often
Misericordia.O18.131 Þat man shal man saue · þorw a maydenes helpe
Misericordia.O18.131 And þat was tynt þorw tre · tree shal it wynne
Misericordia.O18.131 And þat deth doun brouȝte · deth shal releue

¶ Þat þow tellest quod treuth · is but a tale of waltrot
For Adam & Eue · & abraham with other
Patriarkes & prophetes · þat in peyne liggen
Leue þow neuere þat ȝone liȝte · hem alofte brynge
Ne haue hem out of helle · helde þi tonge mercy
It is but a trufle þat þow tellest · I treuth wote þe sothe
For þat is ones in helle · out cometh it neuere
Iob þe prophete patriarke · reproueth þi sawes
Iob.vii.Cr3.18.153 Quia in inferno nulla est redempcio

Iob.vii.Cr2.18.154 ¶ Þanne mercy ful myldly · mouthed þise wordes
Iob.vii.Cr2.18.154 Thorw experience quod she · I hope þei shal be saued
Iob.vii.Cr2.18.154 For venym fordoth venym · & þat I proue by resoun
Iob.vii.Cr2.18.154 For of alle venymes · foulest is þe scorpioun
Iob.vii.Cr2.18.154 May no medcyne helpe · þe place þere he styngeth
Iob.vii.Cr2.18.154 Tyl he be ded & do þer-to · þe yuel he destroyeth
Iob.vii.Cr2.18.154 Poyson expelleth poyson .Cr3.18.160 Þe fyrst venymouste · þorw venym of hym-self
Iob.vii.Cr2.18.154 Poyson expelleth poyson .Cr3.18.160 So shal þis deth fordo · I dar my lyf legge
Iob.vii.Cr2.18.154 Poyson expelleth poyson .Cr3.18.160 Al þat deth dyd furste · þorw þe deuelles entysynge
Iob.vii.Cr2.18.154 Poyson expelleth poyson .Cr3.18.160 And riȝt as þorw gyle · man was bigyled
Iob.vii.Cr2.18.154 Poyson expelleth poyson .Cr3.18.160 sighteO18.165. A caret/punctus beside it and a solidus punctus above seeþ indicate that substitution was intended. O alone has seeþ. Most B manuscripts have sleighte. So shal grace þat bigan · make a good sleighte

¶ Now suffre we seyde treuth · I se as me þinketh
Out of þe nippe of þe north · nouȝt ful fer hennes
IusticiaC2.18.169 Iusticia .O18.169 Riȝtwisnesse come rennynge · reste we þe while
IusticiaC2.18.169 Iusticia .O18.169 For he wote more þan we · he was er we bothe

¶ That is soth seyde mercy · and I se here bi southe
PaxC2.18.172 Pax .O18.172 Where pees cometh playinge · in pacience yclothed
PaxC2.18.172 Pax .O18.172 Loue hath coueyted hir longe · leue I none other

PaxC2.18.172 Pax .O18.172 Þat ouer-houeth helle þus · [he] vs shal telle

¶ Whan pees in pacience yclothed · approched nere hem tweyne
Riȝtwisnesse hir reuerenced · for her riche clothyng
And preyed pees to telle hir · to what place she wolde
And in her gay garnementz · whom she grete þouȝte

¶ What rauestow quod riȝtwisnesse or þow art riȝt dronke
Leuestow þat ȝonde liȝte · vnlouke myȝte helle
And saue mannes soule · sustre wene it neure
At þe bygynnynge god · gaf þe dome hym-selue
Þat Adam & Eue · and alle þat hem suwed
Shulde deye doune-riȝte · and dwelle in pyne after
If þat þei touched a tre · and þe fruite eten
Adam afterward · aȝeines his defence
Frette of þat fruit · & forsoke as it were
Þe loue of owre lorde · and his lore bothe
And folwed þat þe fende tauȝte · & his felawes wille
Aȝeines resoun I riȝtwisnesse · recorde þus with treuth
| C18.205 Þat her peyne be perpetuel · & no preyere hem helpe
| C18.205 For-þi late hem chewe as þei chose · & chyde we nouȝt sustres
| C18.205 For it is botelees bale · þe bite þat þei eten

+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 ¶ And shal preue quod pees · her peyne mote haue ende
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 And wo in-to wel · mowe wende atte laste
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 For had þei wist of no wo · wel had þei nouȝte knowen
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 Contraries are knowen bi the contraries .Cr3.18.206 For no wiȝte wote what wel is · þat neuere wo suffred
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 Contraries are knowen bi the contraries .Cr3.18.206 Ne what is hote hunger · þat had neuere defaute
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 Contraries are knowen bi the contraries .Cr3.18.206 If no nyȝte ne were · no man as I leue
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 Contraries are knowen bi the contraries .Cr3.18.206 Shulde wite witterly · what day is to mene
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 Contraries are knowen bi the contraries .Cr3.18.206 ¶ Shulde neuere riȝte riche man · þat lyueth · in reste & ese
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 Contraries are knowen bi the contraries .Cr3.18.206 Wyte what wo is · ne were þe deth of kynde
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 Contraries are knowen bi the contraries .Cr3.18.206 So god þat bygan al · of his good wille
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 Contraries are knowen bi the contraries .Cr3.18.206 Bycam man of a mayde · mankynde to saue
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 Contraries are knowen bi the contraries .Cr3.18.206 And suffred to be solde · to see þe sorwe of deyinge
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 Contraries are knowen bi the contraries .Cr3.18.206 The which vnknitteth al kare · & comsynge is of reste
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 Contraries are knowen bi the contraries .Cr3.18.206 For til modicum mete with vs · I may it wel avowe
+L17.208 Nota beneM18.208 Contraries are knowen bi the contraries .Cr3.18.206 Wote no wiȝte as I wene · what is ynough to mene

nota beneM18.223 ¶ For-þi god of his goodnesse · þe fyrste gome Adam
nota beneM18.223 Sette hym in solace · & in souereigne myrthe
nota beneM18.223 And sith he suffred hym synne · sorwe to fele
nota beneM18.223 To wite what wel was · kyndelich to knowe it
nota beneM18.223 And after god auntred hym-self · and toke Adames kynde
nota beneM18.223 To wyte what he hath suffred · in þre sondri places
nota beneM18.223 Bothe in heuene & in erthe · & now til helle he þynketh
nota beneM18.223 To wite what al wo is · þat wote of al ioye

¶ So it shal fare bi þis folke · her foly & her synne
Shal lere hem what langour is · & lisse with-outen ende
~ C18.233 Wote no wighte what werre is · þere þat pees regneth
~ C18.233 Ne what is witterly wel · til weyllowey hym teche

Bokes be bolde[?]Cr3.18.233 ¶ Thanne was þere a wiȝte · with two brode eyen
Bokes be bolde[?]Cr3.18.233 # de Iuramento BokeM18.236 Boke hiȝte þat beupere · a bolde man of speche
Bokes be bolde[?]Cr3.18.233 # de Iuramento BokeM18.236 By godes body quod þis boke · I wil bere witnesse

¶ Suffre we seide treuth · I here & se bothe
How a spirit speketh to helle · & bit vnspere þe ȝatis
Psam.xxiiii.Cr2.18.267 Ps.xxiiii.Cr3.18.266 Attollite portas &c
Psam.xxiiii.Cr2.18.267 Ps.xxiiii.Cr3.18.266 A voice loude in þat liȝte to lucifer cryeth
Psam.xxiiii.Cr2.18.267 Ps.xxiiii.Cr3.18.266 Prynces of þis place · vnpynneth & vnlouketh
Psam.xxiiii.Cr2.18.267 Ps.xxiiii.Cr3.18.266 For here cometh with croune · þat kynge is of glorie
Psam.xxiiii.Cr2.18.267 Ps.xxiiii.Cr3.18.266 Thanne syked sathan · & seyde to hem alle
Psam.xxiiii.Cr2.18.267 Ps.xxiiii.Cr3.18.266 Suche a lyȝte aȝeines owre leue · Lazar it fette
Psam.xxiiii.Cr2.18.267 Ps.xxiiii.Cr3.18.266 Care & combraunce · is comen to vs alle
Psam.xxiiii.Cr2.18.267 Ps.xxiiii.Cr3.18.266 If þis kynge come in · mankynde wil he fecche
Psam.xxiiii.Cr2.18.267 Ps.xxiiii.Cr3.18.266 And lede it þer hym lyketh · & lyȝtlych me bynde
Psam.xxiiii.Cr2.18.267 Ps.xxiiii.Cr3.18.266 Patriarkes & prophetes · han parled her-of longe
Psam.xxiiii.Cr2.18.267 Ps.xxiiii.Cr3.18.266 Þat such a lorde & a lyȝte · shulde lede hem alle hennes

¶ Lysteneth quod Lucifer · for I þis lorde knowe
Bothe þis lorde & þis liȝte · is longe ago I knewe hym
May no deth hym dere · ne no deueles queyntise
And where he wil is his waye · ac war hym of þe periles
If he reue me my riȝte · he robbeth me by maistrye
For by riȝt & bi resoun · þo renkes þat ben here
Bodye & soule ben myne · bothe gode & ille
Lucifer reasoneth the matterCr3.18.284 For hym-self seyde þat sire is of heuene
Lucifer reasoneth the matterCr3.18.284 Ȝif Adam ete þe apple · alle shulde deye
Lucifer reasoneth the matterCr3.18.284 And dwelle with vs deueles · þis þretynge he made
Lucifer reasoneth the matterCr3.18.284 And he þat sothenesse is seyde þise wordes
Lucifer reasoneth the matterCr3.18.284 And sitthen I seised · seuene hundreth wyntre
Lucifer reasoneth the matterCr3.18.284 - C18.290 I leue þat lawe nil nauȝte · lete hym þe leest

Nota · C18.291 ¶ That is sothe seyde Sathan · but I me sore drede
Nota · C18.291 id est adamC2.18.292 For þow gete hem with gyle · & his gardyne breke
Nota · C18.291 id est adamC2.18.292 And in semblaunce of a serpent · sat on þe appeltre
Nota · C18.291 id est adamC2.18.292 And eggedest hem to ete · Eue by hir-selue
Nota · C18.291 id est adamC2.18.292 And toldest hir a tale · of tresoun were þe wordes
Nota · C18.291 id est adamC2.18.292 And so þow haddest hem oute & hider atte laste
Nota · C18.291 id est adamC2.18.292 · nota · C18.297 It is nouȝte graythely geten · þere gyle is þe Rote
Nota · C18.291 id est adamC2.18.292 · nota · C18.297 For god wil nouȝt be bigiled · quod Gobelyn ne bi-iaped
Nota · C18.291 id est adamC2.18.292 · nota · C18.297 We haue no trewe title to hem · for þorwgh tresoun were þei dampned
Nota · C18.291 id est adamC2.18.292 · nota · C18.297 Certes I drede me quod þe deuel · leste treuth wil hem fecche

¶ Þis þretty wynter as I wene · hath he gone & preched
I haue assailled hym with synne · & some-tyme yasked
Where he were god or goddes sone · he gaf me shorte answere
And þus hath he trolled forth · þis two & thretty wynter
And whan I seighe it was so · slepyng I went
Of a dreem .O18.308 To warne pilates wyf · what dones man was ihesus
Of a dreem .O18.308 For iuwes hateden hym · and han done hym to deth
Of a dreem .O18.308 Pilates wyfe .Cr3.18.306 I wolde haue lengthed his lyf · for I leued ȝif he deyede
Of a dreem .O18.308 Pilates wyfe .Cr3.18.306 That his soule wolde suffre · no synne in his syȝte
Of a dreem .O18.308 Pilates wyfe .Cr3.18.306 For þe body whil it on bones ȝede · aboute was euere
Of a dreem .O18.308 Pilates wyfe .Cr3.18.306 To saue men fram synne · ȝif hem-self wolde
Of a dreem .O18.308 Pilates wyfe .Cr3.18.306 And now I se where a soule · cometh hiderward · seyllynge
Of a dreem .O18.308 Pilates wyfe .Cr3.18.306 With glorie & with grete liȝte · god it is I wote wel
Of a dreem .O18.308 Pilates wyfe .Cr3.18.306 I rede we flee quod he · faste alle hennes
Of a dreem .O18.308 Pilates wyfe .Cr3.18.306 For vs were better nouȝte be · þan biden his syȝte
Of a dreem .O18.308 Pilates wyfe .Cr3.18.306 For þi lesynges Lucifer · loste is al owre praye
Of a dreem .O18.308 Pilates wyfe .Cr3.18.306 Firste þorw þe we fellen · fro heuene so heigh
Of a dreem .O18.308 Pilates wyfe .Cr3.18.306 For we leued þi lesynges · ylore we haue Adam
Of a dreem .O18.308 Pilates wyfe .Cr3.18.306 And al owre lordeship I leue · alonde & a water
Of a dreem .O18.308 Pilates wyfe .Cr3.18.306 Luc.xii.Cr2.18.321 Luke.xii.Cr3.18.318 Nunc princeps huius mundi eicietur foras

¶ Efte þe liȝte bad vnlouke · & Lucifer answered
What lorde artow quod lucifer · quis est iste
Rex glorie · þe liȝte sone seide
And lorde of myȝte & of mayne · & al manere vertues · dominus virtutum
Dukes of þis dym place · anon vndo þis ȝates
That cryst may come in · þe kynges sone of heuene
And with þat breth helle brake · with Beliales barres
For any wye or warde · wide opene þe ȝatis

¶ Patriarkes & prophetes · populus in tenebris
Songen seynt Iohanes songe · ecce agnus dei
Lucyfer loke ne myȝte · so lyȝte hym ableynte
And þo þat owre [lorde] loued · in-to his liȝte he lauȝte
And seyde to sathan · lo here my soule to amendes
For alle synneful soules · to saue þo þat ben worthy
Myne þei be & of me · I may þe bette hem clayme
Al-þough resoun recorde & riȝt of my-self
That if þei ete þe apple · alle shulde deye
I bihyȝte hem nouȝt here · helle for euere
For þe dede þat þei dede · þi deceyte it made
With gyle þow hem gete · agayne al resoun
For in my paleys paradys · in persone of an addre
Falseliche þow fettest þere · þynge þat I loued

¶ And I in lyknesse of a leode · þat lorde am of heuene
Graciouslich þi gyle haue quytte · go gyle aȝeine gyle
And as Adam & alle · þorw a tre deyden
Adam & alle þorwe a tree · shal torne aȝeine to lyue
And gyle is bigyled · & in his gyle fallen
psalm.viiCr2.18.371 Psal.vii.Cr3.18.367 Et cecidit in foueam quam fecit
psalm.viiCr2.18.371 Psal.vii.Cr3.18.367 Now bygynneth þi gyle · ageyne þe to tourne
psalm.viiCr2.18.371 Psal.vii.Cr3.18.367 And my grace to growe · ay gretter & wyder
psalm.viiCr2.18.371 Psal.vii.Cr3.18.367 Þe bitternesse þat þow hast browe · brouke it þi-seluen
psalm.viiCr2.18.371 Psal.vii.Cr3.18.367 Þat art doctour of deth · drynke þat þow madest

¶ For I þat am lorde of lyf · loue is my drynke
And for þat drynke to-day · I deyde vpon erthe
I fauȝte so me þrestes ȝet · for mannes soule sake
May no drynke me moiste · ne my thruste slake
Tyl þe vendage falle · in þe vale of iosephath
Iudicium generaleC2.18.381 Þat I drynke riȝte ripe must · resureccio mortuorum
Iudicium generaleC2.18.381 And þanne shal I come as a kynge · crouned with angeles
Iudicium generaleC2.18.381 And han out of helle · alle mennes soules ·

nota luciferM18.384 ¶ Fendes and fendekynes · bifore me shulle stande
nota luciferM18.384 And be at my biddynge · where-so-eure me lyketh
nota luciferM18.384 And to be merciable to man · þanne my kynde it asketh
nota luciferM18.384 For we beth bretheren of blode · but nouȝte in baptesme alle

nota luciferM18.384 CaueC2.18.389 Palme.ii.Cr2.18.389 Psal.li.Cr3.18.386 of the harowyng of hell [?]Cr3.18.391 Lawe wolde he ȝeue hym lyf · if he loked on hym
¶ And I þat am kynge of kynges · shal come suche a tyme
There dome to þe deth · dampneth al wikked
And ȝif lawe wil I loke on hem · it lithe in my grace
Whether þei deye or deye nouȝte · for þat þei deden ille
Be it any þinge abouȝte · þe boldenesse of her synnes
I may do mercy þorw riȝtwisnesse · & alle my wordes trewe
And þough holiwrit wil þat I be wroke · of hem þat deden ille
Nullum malum inpunitum &c
Thei shul be clensed clereliche · & wasshen of her synnes
The prison ofpurgatoryC2.18.405 In my prisoun purgatorie · til parce it hote
The prison ofpurgatoryC2.18.405 And my mercy shal be shewed · to manye of my bretheren
The prison ofpurgatoryC2.18.405 For blode may suffre blode · bothe hungry & akale
The prison ofpurgatoryC2.18.405 Ac blode may nouȝt se blode · blede but hym rewe

¶ Many hundreth of angeles · harpeden & songen
Culpat caro purgat caro · regnat deus dei caro

· versusC18.420 ¶ Thanne piped pees · of poysye a note

¶ Thow seist soth seyde ryȝtwisnesse · & reuerentlich hir kyste
Psa.ixxxv.Cr2.18.438 Pees & pees here · per secula seculorum

Psa.xxxxiii.Cr2.18.443 ¶ Tyl þe daye dawed · þis damaiseles daunced
Psa.xxxxiii.Cr2.18.443 That men rongen to þe resurexioun · & riȝt with þat I waked
Psa.xxxxiii.Cr2.18.443 And called kitte my wyf · and kalote my douȝter
Psa.xxxxiii.Cr2.18.443 Ariseth & reuerenceth · goddes ressurrexioun
Psa.xxxxiii.Cr2.18.443 And crepeth to þe the crosse on knees · & kisseth it for a iuwel
Psa.xxxxiii.Cr2.18.443 For goddes blissed body · it bar for owre bote
Psa.xxxxiii.Cr2.18.443 And it afereth þe fende · for suche is þe myȝte
Psa.xxxxiii.Cr2.18.443 May no grysly gost · glyde þere it shadweth

Passus Vndevicesimus


Thus I awaked & wrote · what I had dremed
And diȝte me derely · & dede me to cherche
To here holy þe masse · & to be houseled after
In myddes of þe masse · þo men ȝede to offrynge
I fel eftsones a-slepe · & sodeynly me mette
That Pieres þe plowman · was paynted al blody
And come in with a crosse · bifor þe comune peple
And riȝte lyke in alle lymes · to owre lorde ihesu
And þanne called I conscience · to kenne me þe sothe
Is þis ihesus þe iuster quod I · þat iuwes did to deth
Or it is Pieres þe plowman · who paynted hym so rede
Piercescote armour . nota Quod conscience & kneled þo · þise aren Pieres armes
Piercescote armour . nota His coloures & his cotearmure · ac he þat cometh so blody
Piercescote armour . nota Is cryst with his crosse · conqueroure of crystene

# quare Cristus magis quam Ihesus X ¶ Why calle ȝe hym cryst quod I · sithenes iuwes calle hym ihesus
# quare Cristus magis quam Ihesus X Patriarkes & prophetes · prophecyed bifore
# quare Cristus magis quam Ihesus X Þat alkyn creatures · shulden knelen & bowen
# quare Cristus magis quam Ihesus X Anon as men nempned · þe name of god Ihesu
# quare Cristus magis quam Ihesus X - C19.17 Ergo is no name · to þe name of ihesus
# quare Cristus magis quam Ihesus X - C19.17 Ne none so nedeful to nempne · by nyȝte ne by daye
# quare Cristus magis quam Ihesus X - C19.17 For alle derke deuelles · aren adradde to heren it
# quare Cristus magis quam Ihesus X - C19.17 And synful aren solaced · & saued bi þat name
# quare Cristus magis quam Ihesus X - C19.17 And ȝe callen hym cryst · for what cause telleth me
# quare Cristus magis quam Ihesus X - C19.17 Is cryst more of myȝte · & more worthy name
# quare Cristus magis quam Ihesus X - C19.17 Þan ihesu or ihesus · þat al owre ioye come of

¶ Thow knowest wel quod conscience · and þow konne resoun
· Nota · C19.25 That knyȝte kynge conqueroure · may be o persone
· Nota · C19.25 To be called a kniȝte is faire · for men shal knele to hym
· Nota · C19.25 To be called a Kynge is fairer · for he may knyȝtes make
· Nota · C19.25 Ac to be conquerour called · þat cometh of special grace
· Nota · C19.25 And of hardynesse of herte · & of hendenesse
· Nota · C19.25 To make lordes of laddes · of londe þat he wynneth
· Nota · C19.25 And fre men foule thralles · þat folweth nouȝt his lawes

¶ The iuwes þat were gentil men · ihesu þei dispised
Bothe his lore & his lawe · now ar þei lowe cherlis
As wyde as þe worlde is wonyeth · þere none
But vnder tribut & taillage · as tykes & cherles
And þo þat bicome crysten · by conseille of þe baptiste
Christe / crowned kynge . Aren frankeleynes fre men · þorw fullyng þat þei toke
Christe / crowned kynge . And gentel men with ihesu · for Ihesus was yfolled
Christe / crowned kynge . And vppon caluarye on crosse · ycrouned kynge of iewes

¶ It bicometh to a Kynge · to kepe and to defende
And conquerour of conquest · his lawes & his large
And so ded Ihesus þe iewes · he iustified & tauȝte hem
Þe lawe of lyf · that last shal euere
And fended fram foule yueles · feueres & fluxes
and fro fendes þat in hem was & fals bileue
Þo was he ihesus of iewes called · gentel prophete
And kynge of her kyngdome · & croune bar of þornes

¶ And þo conquered he on crosse · as conquerour noble
Myȝt no deth hym fordo · ne adown brynge
That he ne aros & regned · and rauysshed helle
And þo was he conquerour called · of quikke & of ded
For he ȝaf Adam & Eue · and other mo blisse
Þat longe hadde leyne bifore · as lucyferes cherlesHereafter follow 19.56-59 in KD, from alpha, but they are not annotated.

¶ And sith he ȝaf largely · alle his lele lyges
Places in paradys · at her partynge hennes
He may wel be called conquerour · & þat is cryst to mene

¶ Ac þe cause þat he cometh þus · with crosse of his passioun
notaW19.60 Is to wissen vs þere-wyth · þat whan þat we ben tempted
notaW19.60 Þer-with to fyȝte & fenden vs · fro fallyng in-to synne
notaW19.60 And se bi his sorwe · þat who-so loueth ioye
notaW19.60 # quia necesse est penitenciam agereM19.63 To penaunce & to pouerte he moste putten hym-seluen
notaW19.60 # quia necesse est penitenciam agereM19.63 And moche wo in þis worlde · willen & suffren

¶ Ac to carpe more of cryst · and how he come to þat name
Faithly forto speke · his firste name was ihesus
Tho he was borne in bethleem as þe boke telleth
And cam to take mankynde · kynges and aungeles
Reuerenced hym faire · with richesse of erthe
Angeles out of heuene · come knelyng & songe
THe gyftes that þe iii . kyngs offered .Cr3.19.71 Gloria in excelsis deo &c

¶ Kynges come after · kneled & offred
Mirre & moche golde · with-outen mercy askynge
Or any kynnes catel · but knowlechyng hym soeuereigne
Bothe of sonde sonne & see · & sithenes þei went
- C19.74 In-to her kyngene kyth · by conseille of angeles
- C19.74 And there was þat worde fulfilled · þe which þow of speke
- C19.74 Phili.iiiCr2.19.78 Phili. ii,Cr3.19.78 Omnia celestia terrestria flectantur in hoc nomine Ihesu
- C19.74 Phili.iiiCr2.19.78 Phili. ii,Cr3.19.78 · nota · C19.77 For alle þe angeles of heuene · at his burth kneled
- C19.74 Phili.iiiCr2.19.78 Phili. ii,Cr3.19.78 · nota · C19.77 And al þe witte of þe worlde · was in þo þre kynges
- C19.74 Phili.iiiCr2.19.78 Phili. ii,Cr3.19.78 · nota · C19.77 Resoun & riȝtfulnesse · & reuth þei offred
- C19.74 Phili.iiiCr2.19.78 Phili. ii,Cr3.19.78 · nota · C19.77 Wherfore & whi · wyse men þat tyme
- C19.74 Phili.iiiCr2.19.78 Phili. ii,Cr3.19.78 · nota · C19.77 Maistres & lettred men · Magy hem called

XL19.84 bene loquiturM19.84 ¶ That o kynge cam with resoun · keuered vnder sense
XL19.84 bene loquiturM19.84 Þe secounde kynge sitthe · sothliche offred
XL19.84 bene loquiturM19.84 Riȝtwisnesse vnder red golde resouns felawe

XL19.84 bene loquiturM19.84 - C19.85 # discripcionem trium MunerumM19.87 And resoun to riche golde · to riȝte & to treuthe

XL19.84 bene loquiturM19.84 - C19.85 # discripcionem trium MunerumM19.87 Þorw þre kynne kynges · knelynge to ihesu

¶ Ac for alle þise preciouse presentz owre lorde prynce ihesus
Was neyther kynge ne conquerour · til he gan to wexe
In þe manere of a man · & þat by moche sleight
As it bicometh a conquerour · to konne many sleightes
And many wyles & witte · þat wil ben a leder
And so did ihesu in his dayes · who-so had tyme to telle it
Sum-tyme he suffred · & sum-tyme he hydde hym
And sum-tyme he fauȝte faste · & fleigh otherwhile
- C19.99 And some-tyme he gaf good · & graunted hele bothe
- C19.99 Lyf & lyme · as hym lyste he wrought
- C19.99 As kynde is of a conquerour · so comsed ihesu
- C19.99 Tyl he had alle hem · þat he fore bledde

¶ In his iuuente þis ihesus · atte iuwen feste
Christ worketh miraclesCr3.19.107 Water in-to wyn tourned · as holy writ telleth
Christ worketh miraclesCr3.19.107 And þere bigan god · of his grace to dowel
Christ worketh miraclesCr3.19.107 For wyn is lykned to lawe · & lyf of holynesse
Christ worketh miraclesCr3.19.107 And lawe lakked þo · for men loued nouȝt her enemys
Christ worketh miraclesCr3.19.107 And cryst conseilleth þus · & comaundeth bothe
Christ worketh miraclesCr3.19.107 Bothe to lered & to lewed · to louye owre enemys
Christ worketh miraclesCr3.19.107 So atte feste firste as I bifore tolde
Christ worketh miraclesCr3.19.107 Bygan god of his grace & goodnesse to dowel
Christ worketh miraclesCr3.19.107 And þo was he cleped & called nouȝt holy cryst but Ihesu
Christ worketh miraclesCr3.19.107 # beneM19.116 A fauntfyn ful of witte · filius marie

¶ For bifor his moder marie · made he þat wonder
Þat she furste & formest · ferme shulde bilieue
That he þorw grace was gete · & of no gome elles
dixit & facta suntM19.120 He wrouȝt þat bi no witte · but þorw worde one
dixit & facta suntM19.120 After þe kynde þat he come of · þere comsed he dowel
dixit & facta suntM19.120 And whan he was woxen more · in his moder absence
dixit & facta suntM19.120 He made lame to lepe · & ȝaue liȝte to blynde
dixit & facta suntM19.120 And fedde with two fisshes · & with fyue loues ·
dixit & facta suntM19.120 Sore afyngred folke · mo þan fyue thousande
dixit & facta suntM19.120 Þus he conforted carful · & cauȝte a gretter name
dixit & facta suntM19.120 Þe whiche was dobet · where þat he went

¶ Where-of caiphas hadde enuye · & other of þe iewes
And forto doun hym to deth · day & nyȝte þei casten
- C19.137 Kulleden hym on crosse-wyse · at caluarie on fryday
- C19.137 And sithen buryden his body · & beden þat men sholde
- C19.137 Kepen it fro niȝt-comeres · with knyȝtes yarmed
- C19.137 For no frendes shulde hym fecche · for prophetes hem tolde
- C19.137 Þat þat blessed body · of burieles shulde rise
- C19.137 And gone in-to galile · and gladen his apostles
- C19.137 And his moder Marie · þus men bifore demed

¶ The knyȝtes þat kepten it · biknewe it hem-seluen
Þat angeles & archangeles · ar þe day spronge
Come knelynge to þe corps · & songen cristus resurgens
Verrey man bifor hem alle · & forth-with hem he ȝede

¶ The iewes preyed hem pees · & bisouȝte þe knyȝtes
Telle þe comune þat þere cam · a compaignye of his aposteles
And bywicched hem as þei woke · & awey stolen it

¶ Ac Marie Magdeleyne · mette hym bi þe wey
Goynge toward galile · in godhed & manhed
And lyues & lokynge · & she aloude cryde
In eche a compaignye þere she cam · cristus resurgens
Luke.24 Why Christ appeared fyrste to a woman,Cr3.19.158 Þus cam it out þat cryst ouer-cam · rekeuered & lyued
Luke.24 Why Christ appeared fyrste to a woman,Cr3.19.158 Luke.xiiiiCr2.19.159 Sic oportet cristum pati & intrare &c ·
Luke.24 Why Christ appeared fyrste to a woman,Cr3.19.158 Luke.xiiiiCr2.19.159 # women kepe no CowncellM19.160 For þat wommen witeth · may nouȝte wel be conseille

¶ Peter parceyued al þis · & pursued after
Bothe iames & Iohan · Ihesu for to seke
Tadde & ten mo · with Thomas of ynde
And as alle þise wise wyes · weren togideres
In an hous al bishette · & her dore ybarred
Cryst cam in & al closed · bothe dore & ȝates
To peter & to his aposteles · and seyde pax vobis
And toke Thomas by þe hande · and tauȝte hym to grope
And fele with his fyngres · his flesshelich herte

Thomas Dudumys Iohn.xxCr3.19.169 ¶ Thomas touched it · & with his tonge seyde
Thomas Dudumys Iohn.xxCr3.19.169 Deus meus & dominus meus
Thomas Dudumys Iohn.xxCr3.19.169 Thow art my lorde · I bileue · god lorde ihesu
Thomas Dudumys Iohn.xxCr3.19.169 Þow deydest & deth þoledest · and deme shalt vs alle
Thomas Dudumys Iohn.xxCr3.19.169 And now art lyuynge & lokynge · & laste shalt euere

¶ Crist carped þanne · and curteislich seyde
Thomas for þow trowest þis · & trewliche bileuest it
Blessed mote þow be · & be shalt for euere
And blessed mote þei alle be · in body & in soule
That neuere shal se me in siȝte · as þow doste nouthe
And lellich bileuen al þis · I loue hem & blesse hem
Iohn.xxCr3.19.180 Beati qui non viderunt &c ·

Iohn.xx. ¶ And whan þis dede was done · dobest he tauȝte
Iohn.xx. And ȝaf Pieres power · and pardoun he graunted
Iohn.xx. To alle manere men · mercy & forȝyfnes
Iohn.xx. Hym myȝte men to assoille · of alle manere synnes
Iohn.xx. In couenant þat þei come · & knewleche to paye
Iohn.xx. Pierces pardon is pay that þouoweste .Cr3.19.186 To pieres pardon þe plowman · redde quod debes

¶ Thus hath pieres powere · be his pardoun payed
+ To bynde & to vnbynde · bothe here & elles
+ And assoille men of alle synnes · saue of dette one

¶ Anone after an heigh · vp in-to heuene
He went & wonyeth þere · & wil come atte laste
And wil rewarde hym riȝte wel · þat reddit quod debet
Payeth parfitly as pure trewthe wolde
And what persone payeth it nouȝt · punysshen he þinketh
And demen hem at domes-daye · bothe quikke & ded
Þe gode to þe godhede · & to grete ioye
And wikke to wonye · in wo with-outen ende
Þus conscience of crist · & of þe crosse carped
And conseilled me to knele þer-to · & þanne come me þouȝte
The holy Goste,Cr3.19.200 One spiritus paraclitus · to Pieres & to his felawes
The holy Goste,Cr3.19.200 In lyknesse of a liȝtnynge · he lyȝte on hem alle
The holy Goste,Cr3.19.200 And made hem konne & knowe · alkyn langages

¶ I wondred what þat was · & wagged conscience
And was afered of the lyȝte · for in fyres lyknesse
Spiritus paraclitus · ouer-spradde hem alle

¶ Quod conscience & kneled · þis is crystes messager
| C19.206 And cometh fro þe grete god · & grace is his name
| C19.206 Knele now quod conscience · & if þow canst synge
| C19.206 Welcome hym & worshipe hym · with veni creator spiritus

¶ Thanne songe I þat songe · and so did many hundreth
And cryden with conscience · help vs god of grace
And þanne bigan grace · to go with piers plowman
And conseilled hym & conscience · þe comune to sompne
For I wil dele to-daye · & dyuyde grace
| C19.214 To alkynnes creatures · þat kan her fyue wittes
| C19.214 Tresore to lyue by · to her lyues ende
| C19.214 And wepne to fyȝte with · þat wil neure faille
| C19.214 For antecryst & his · al þe worlde shal greue
| C19.214 And acombre þe conscience · but if cryst þe helpe

¶ And fals prophetes fele · flatereres & glosers
Shullen come & be curatoures · ouer kynges & erlis
And pryde shal be pope · prynce of holycherche
Coueytyse & vnkyndenesse · cardinales hym to lede
For-þi quod grace er I go · I wil gyue ȝow tresore
And wepne to fiȝte with · whan antecryst ȝow assailleth
And gaf eche man a grace · to gye with hym-seluen
That ydelnesse encombre hym nouȝt · envye ne pryde
# Gyftis off graceM19.229 Diuisiones graciarum sunt &c ·

¶ Some he ȝaf wytte · with wordes to shewe
The gyftes of the holy gost . Witte to wynne her lyflode with · as þe worlde asketh
The gyftes of the holy gost . As prechoures & prestes & prentyce of lawe
The gyftes of the holy gost . Þei lelly to lyue · by laboure of tonge
The gyftes of the holy gost . And bi witte to wissen other · as grace hem wolde teche

¶ And some he kenned crafte · & kunnynge of syȝte
With sellyng & buggynge · her bylyf to wynne
And some he lered to laboure · a lele lyf & a trewe
And somme he tauȝte to tilie · to dyche & to thecche
To wynne with her lyflode · by lore of his techynge
And some to dyuyne & diuide · noumbres to kenne
And some to compas craftily · & coloures to make
Astronomers .Cr3.19.241 And some to se & to saye · what shulde bifalle
Astronomers .Cr3.19.241 Bothe of wel & of wo · telle it or it felle
Astronomers .Cr3.19.241 As Astronomyenes þorw astronomye · & philosophres wyse

¶ And some to ryde & to recoeure · þat vnriȝtfully was wonne
He wissed hem wynne it aȝeyne · þorw wightnesse of handes
# Folviles lawes ¶ And fecchen it fro fals men · with foluyles lawes
# Folviles lawes And some he lered to lyue · in longynge to ben hennes
# Folviles lawes In pouerte & in penaunce · to preye for alle crystene
# Folviles lawes And alle he lered to be lele · & eche a crafte loue other
# Folviles lawes And forbad hem alle debate · þat none were amonge hem
# Folviles lawes Thowgh some be clenner þan somme · ȝe se wel quod grace
# Folviles lawes +L19.253 Þat he þat vseth þe fairest crafte · to þe foulest I couth haue put hym
# Folviles lawes +L19.253 ~ C19.243 Þinketh alle quod grace · þat grace cometh of my ȝifte
# Folviles lawes +L19.253 ~ C19.243 Loke þat none lakke other · but loueth alle as bretheren

¶ And who þat moste maistries can · be myldest of berynge
And crouneth conscience kynge · & maketh crafte ȝowre stuward
And after craftes conseille · clotheth ȝow & fede
Pierces offices .Cr3.19.257 For I make Pieres þe plowman · my procuratour & my reve
Pierces offices .Cr3.19.257 And Regystrere to receyue · redde quod debes
Pierces offices .Cr3.19.257 My prowor & my plowman · Piers shal ben on erthe
Pierces offices .Cr3.19.257 And for to tulye treuthe · a teme shal he haue

peris plowȝC2.19.250 A New plouhM19.263 ¶ Grace gaue Piers a teme · foure gret oxen
peris plowȝC2.19.250 A New plouhM19.263 Pierce Plowemannes crea.Cr3.19.262 XM19.264 Þat on was Luke a large beste · and a lowe-chered
peris plowȝC2.19.250 A New plouhM19.263 Pierce Plowemannes crea.Cr3.19.262 XM19.264 And marke & mathew þe þrydde · myghty bestes bothe
peris plowȝC2.19.250 A New plouhM19.263 Pierce Plowemannes crea.Cr3.19.262 XM19.264 And ioigned to hem one Iohan · most gentil of alle
peris plowȝC2.19.250 A New plouhM19.263 Pierce Plowemannes crea.Cr3.19.262 XM19.264 Þe prys nete of Piers plow · passyng alle other

¶ And grace gaue pieres · of his goodnesse foure stottis
Al þat his oxen eryed · þey to harwe after
On hyȝte Austyne · & ambrose an other
Gregori þe grete clerke · & Ierome þe gode
Þise foure þe feithe to teche · folweth pieres teme
And harwed in an handwhile · al holy scripture
Wyth two harwes þat þei hadde · an olde & a newe
virtutes CardinalesM19.275 Id est vetus testamentum & nouum

¶ And grace gaue greynes · þe cardynales vertues

notaW19.282, shaped like punctus elevatus sans point ¶ The secounde seed hiȝte spiritus temperancie
notaW19.282, shaped like punctus elevatus sans point TemperanciaC2.19.271 He þat ete of þat seed · hadde suche a kynde
notaW19.282, shaped like punctus elevatus sans point TemperanciaC2.19.271 Shulde neuere mete ne mochel drynke · make hym to swelle
notaW19.282, shaped like punctus elevatus sans point TemperanciaC2.19.271 Ne sholde no scorner ne scolde · oute of skyl hym brynge

FortitudoC2.19.277 ¶ The thridde seed þat Pieres sewe · was spiritus fortitudinis
FortitudoC2.19.277 And who-so eet of þat seed hardy was eure
FortitudoC2.19.277 To suffre al þat god sent · sykenesse & angres
FortitudoC2.19.277 Myȝte no lesynge ne lyere · ne losse of worldely catel
FortitudoC2.19.277 Maken hym for any mournynge · þat he nas merye in soule
FortitudoC2.19.277 And bolde & abydynge · bismeres to suffre
FortitudoC2.19.277 And playeth al with pacyence · & parce michi domine
FortitudoC2.19.277 And couered hym vnder conseille · of catoun þe wyse
FortitudoC2.19.277 Esto forti animo cum sis dampnatus inique

IusticiaC2.19.286 ¶ The fierthe seed þat pieres sewe · was spiritus iusticie
IusticiaC2.19.286 And he þat eet of þat seed · shulde be euere trewe
IusticiaC2.19.286 With god & nouȝt agast · but of gyle one
IusticiaC2.19.286 For gyle goth so pryuely · þat good faith other-while
IusticiaC2.19.286 May nouȝte ben aspyed · for spiritus iusticie

¶ Spiritus iusticie · spareth nouȝte to spille
Iustyce leaueth no sinne vnpunished .Cr3.19.304 Hem þat ben gulty · & forto correcte
Iustyce leaueth no sinne vnpunished .Cr3.19.304 Þe Kynge ȝif he falle · in gylte or in trespasse
Iustyce leaueth no sinne vnpunished .Cr3.19.304 For counteth he no kynges wratthe · whan he in courte sitteth
Iustyce leaueth no sinne vnpunished .Cr3.19.304 To demen as a domes-man · adradde was he neure
Iustyce leaueth no sinne vnpunished .Cr3.19.304 Noither of duke ne of deth · þat he ne dede þe lawe
Iustyce leaueth no sinne vnpunished .Cr3.19.304 For present or for preyere · or any prynces lettres
Iustyce leaueth no sinne vnpunished .Cr3.19.304 He dede equite to alle · euene-forth his powere

¶ Thise foure sedes pieres sewe · and sitthe he did hem harwe
Wyth olde lawe and newe lawe · þat loue myȝte wexe
Amonge þe foure vertues · and vices destroye

- C19.303 ¶ For comunelich in contrees · kammokes & wedes
- C19.303 Fouleth þe fruite in þe felde · þere þei growe togyderes
- C19.303 And so don vices · vertues worthy
- C19.303 Quod Piers harweth alle þat kunneth kynde witte · bi conseille of þis doctours
- C19.303 And tulyeth after her techynge · þe cardinale vertues

¶ Aȝeines þi greynes quod grace · bigynneth for to ripe
Ordeigne þe an hous quod Piers · to herberwe in þi cornes

¶ By god grace quod Piers · ȝe moten gyue tymbre
And ordeyne þat hous · ar ȝe hennes wende

¶ And grace gaue hym þe crosse · with þe croune of þornes
That cryst vpon caluarye · for mankynde on pyned
The foundation of þe church .Cr3.19.326 And of his baptesme & blode · þat he bledde on Rode
The foundation of þe church .Cr3.19.326 He made a maner morter · & mercy it hiȝte
The foundation of þe church .Cr3.19.326 And þere-with grace bigan · to make a good foundement
The foundation of þe church .Cr3.19.326 And watteled it and walled it · with his peynes & his passioun
The foundation of þe church .Cr3.19.326 And of al holywrit · he made a rofe after
The foundation of þe church .Cr3.19.326 Vnitie holyChurcheC2.19.318 And called þat hous vnite · holicherche on englisshe
The foundation of þe church .Cr3.19.326 Vnitie holyChurcheC2.19.318 And whan þis dede was done · grace deuised

The foundation of þe church .Cr3.19.326 Vnitie holyChurcheC2.19.318 peers shevesM19.334 And made presthode haywarde · þe while hym-self went
The foundation of þe church .Cr3.19.326 Vnitie holyChurcheC2.19.318 peers shevesM19.334 As wyde as þe worlde is · with pieres to tulye treuthe

Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 ¶ Now is Pieres to þe plow · & pruyde it aspyde
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 And gadered hym a grete oest · to greuen he þinketh
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 Conscience and al crystene · and cardinale vertues
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 Blowe hem doune & breke hem · & bite atwo þe mores
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 And sent forth surquydous · his seriaunt of armes
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 And his spye spille-loue · one speke yuel byhynde
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 Þise two come to conscience · and to crystene peple
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 And tolde hem tydynges · þat tyne þei shulde þe sedes
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 That Pieres þere hadde ysowen · þe cardynal vertues
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 And Pieres berne worth broke · & þei þat ben in vnite
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 Shulle come out · & conscience ; & ȝowre two caples
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 Confessioun & contricioun · and ȝowre carte þe byleue
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 Shal be coloured so queyntly · and keuered vnder owre sophistrie
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 +L19.351 /nota/M19.351 Þat consci[ence] shal nouȝte ; knowe by contricioun
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 +L19.351 /nota/M19.351 Ne by confessioun ; who is cristene or hethen
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 +L19.351 /nota/M19.351 Ne no maner marchaunt · þat with moneye deleth
Pride enmeth the church .Cr3.19.337 +L19.351 /nota/M19.351 Where he wynne wyth riȝte · with wronge or with vsure

¶ With suche coloures & queyntise ; cometh pryde yarmed
With þe lorde þat lyueth after · þe luste of his body
To wasten on welfare · and on wykked kepynge
Al þe worlde in a while · þorw owre witte quod pruyde

¶ Quod conscience to alle crystene þo · my conseille is to wende
The way to withstand pryde .Cr3.19.359 Hastiliche in-to vnyte · & holde we vs þere
The way to withstand pryde .Cr3.19.359 And preye we þat a pees were · in Piers berne þe plowman
The way to withstand pryde .Cr3.19.359 For witterly I wote wel · we beth nouȝte of strengthe
The way to withstand pryde .Cr3.19.359 To gone agayne pryde · but grace were with vs

¶ And þanne cam kynde wytte · conscience to teche
And cryde & comaunded · al crystene peple
For to deluen a dyche · depe aboute vnite
+L19.367 That holycherche stode in vnite · as it a pyle [weere]

¶ Conscience comaunded þo · al crystene to delue
And make a muche mote · þat myȝte ben a strengthe
To helpe holycherche · & hem þat it kepeth

¶ Thanne alkyn crystene · saue comune wommen
Who thi be that neuer repent .Cr3.19.371 Repenteden & refused synne · saue they one
Who thi be that neuer repent .Cr3.19.371 And fals men flateres · vsureres and theues
Who thi be that neuer repent .Cr3.19.371 Lyeres and questmongeres · þat were forsworen ofte
Who thi be that neuer repent .Cr3.19.371 Wytynge and willefully · with þe false helden
Who thi be that neuer repent .Cr3.19.371 And for syluer were forswore · sothely þei wist it

¶ Þere nas no crystene creature · þat kynde witte hadde
Saue schrewes one · suche as I spak of
That he ne halpe a quantite · holynesse to wexe
Somme þorw bedes byddynge · and some þorw pylgrymage
And other pryue penaunce · and some þorw penyes delynge

¶ And þanne welled water · for wikked werkes
Egerlich ernynge · out of mennes eyen
Clennesse of þe comune · & clerkes clene lyuynge
Made vnite holicherche · in holynesse to stonde
I care nouȝte quod conscience · þough pryde come nouthe
Þe lorde of luste shal be letted · al þis lente I hope
Comeþ quod conscience · ȝe cristene and dyneth
Þat han laboured lelly · al þis lente tyme
Here is bred yblessed · and goddes body þer-vnder
Grace þorw goddes worde · gaue Pieres power
Myȝtes to maken it · & men to ete it after
In helpe of her hele · onys in a moneth
Or as ofte as þey hadden nede · þo þat hadde ypayed
To pieres pardoun þe plowman · redde quod debes

¶ How quod al þe comune · þow conseillest vs to ȝelde
Al þat we owen any wyȝte · ar we go to housel

¶ That is my conseille quod conscience & cardynale vertues
Þat vche man forȝyue other · and þat wyl þe pater noster
Math.vi.Cr2.19.400 Math.viCr3.19.399 Et dimitte nobis debita nostra · &c ·
Math.vi.Cr2.19.400 Math.viCr3.19.399 And so to ben assoilled · & sithen ben houseled

What lucre maye dooe .Cr3.19.401 ¶ Ȝe bawe quod a brewere · I wil nouȝt be reuled
What lucre maye dooe .Cr3.19.401 Bi ihesu for al ȝowre ianglynge · with spiritus iusticie
What lucre maye dooe .Cr3.19.401 Ne after conscience by cryste · whil I can selle
What lucre maye dooe .Cr3.19.401 Bothe dregges & draffe · and drawe it at on hole
What lucre maye dooe .Cr3.19.401 Þikke ale and þinne ale · for þat is my kynde
What lucre maye dooe .Cr3.19.401 And nouȝte hakke after holynesse · holde þi tonge conscience
What lucre maye dooe .Cr3.19.401 Of spiritus iusticie · þow spekest moche an ydel

¶ Caytyue quod conscience · cursed wrecche
Vnblessed artow brewere · but if þe god helpe
But þow lyue by lore · of spiritus iusticie
Þe chief seed þat Pieres sewe · ysaued worstow neure
But conscience þe comune fede · and cardynale vertues
Leue it wel þei ben loste · bothe lyf & soule

De papa .O14.343 Pierce foloweth þe example of GodCr3.19.433 Math.vCr2.19.437 Math.v.Cr3.19.435 And trauailleth & tulyeth · for a tretour also sore
De papa .O14.343 Pierce foloweth þe example of GodCr3.19.433 Math.vCr2.19.437 Math.v.Cr3.19.435 As for a trewe tydy man · al tymes ylyke
De papa .O14.343 Pierce foloweth þe example of GodCr3.19.433 Math.vCr2.19.437 Math.v.Cr3.19.435 And worshiped be he þat wrouȝte al · bothe good & wykke
De papa .O14.343 Pierce foloweth þe example of GodCr3.19.433 Math.vCr2.19.437 Math.v.Cr3.19.435 Of the PopeCr3.19.444 And suffreth þat synful be · til some tyme þat þei repente
