Of land lordes .Cr3.19.463 ¶ Thanne loughe þere a lorde · & by þis liȝte sayde
Of land lordes .Cr3.19.463 I halde it ryȝte & resoun · of my reue to take
Of land lordes .Cr3.19.463 Al þat myne auditour or elles my stuwarde
Of land lordes .Cr3.19.463 Conseilleth me by her acounte · & my clerkes wrytynge

¶ With spiritus intellectus · they seke þe reues rolles
+L19.470 And with spiritus fortitudinis · fecche [it] I wole

notaM19.471 ¶ And þanne come þere a kynge · & bi his croune seyde
notaM19.471 Of kingsCr3.19.470 a profecyG20.458 I am Kynge with croune · þe comune to reule
notaM19.471 Of kingsCr3.19.470 a profecyG20.458 XG20.459. This corresponds to a similar sign in the table of contents. Possibly these marks were made by WH. And holykirke & clergye · fro cursed men to defende
notaM19.471 Of kingsCr3.19.470 a profecyG20.458 XG20.459. This corresponds to a similar sign in the table of contents. Possibly these marks were made by WH. And if me lakketh to lyue by · þe lawe wil I take it
notaM19.471 Of kingsCr3.19.470 a profecyG20.458 XG20.459. This corresponds to a similar sign in the table of contents. Possibly these marks were made by WH. Þere I may hastlokest it haue · for I am hed of lawe
notaM19.471 Of kingsCr3.19.470 a profecyG20.458 XG20.459. This corresponds to a similar sign in the table of contents. Possibly these marks were made by WH. For ȝe ben but membres · & I aboue alle
notaM19.471 Of kingsCr3.19.470 a profecyG20.458 XG20.459. This corresponds to a similar sign in the table of contents. Possibly these marks were made by WH. And sith I am ȝowre aller hed · I am ȝowre aller hele
notaM19.471 Of kingsCr3.19.470 a profecyG20.458 XG20.459. This corresponds to a similar sign in the table of contents. Possibly these marks were made by WH. And holycherche chief help · & chiftaigne of þe comune
notaM19.471 Of kingsCr3.19.470 a profecyG20.458 XG20.459. This corresponds to a similar sign in the table of contents. Possibly these marks were made by WH. And what I take of ȝow two · I take it atte techynge
notaM19.471 Of kingsCr3.19.470 a profecyG20.458 XG20.459. This corresponds to a similar sign in the table of contents. Possibly these marks were made by WH. Of spiritus iusticie for I · iugge ȝow alle
notaM19.471 Of kingsCr3.19.470 a profecyG20.458 XG20.459. This corresponds to a similar sign in the table of contents. Possibly these marks were made by WH. So I may baldely be houseled · for I borwe neuere
notaM19.471 Of kingsCr3.19.470 a profecyG20.458 XG20.459. This corresponds to a similar sign in the table of contents. Possibly these marks were made by WH. Ne craue of my comune · but as my kynde asketh

¶ In condicioun quod conscience · þat þow konne defende
And rule þi rewme in resoun · riȝt wel & in treuth
De potestate regis .O19.394 Take þow may in resoun as þi lawe asketh
De potestate regis .O19.394 Omnia tua sunt ad defendendum set non ad depredandum
De potestate regis .O19.394 Þe vyker hadde fer home · & faire toke his leue
De potestate regis .O19.394 And I awakned þere-with · & wrote as me mette

Passus vicesimus & primus de dobest


Thanne as I went by þe way · whan I was þus awaked
Heuy-chered I ȝede · and elynge in herte
I ne wiste where to ete · ne at what place
And it neighed nyeghe þe none · & with nede I mette
That afronted me foule · and faitour me called
Coudestow nouȝte excuse þe · as dede þe Kynge & other
Necessitas Þat þow toke to þi bylyf · to clothes and to sustenance
Necessitas As by techynge & by tellynge · of spiritus temperancie
Necessitas And þow nome namore · þan nede þe tauȝte
Necessitas Nede hathe no Lawe And nede ne hath no lawe · ne neure shal falle in dette
Necessitas Nede hathe no Lawe For þre thynges he taketh · his lyf forto saue
Necessitas Nede hathe no Lawe That is mete whan men hym werneth · & he no moneye weldeth
Necessitas Nede hathe no Lawe ¶ Ne wyght none wil ben his borwe · ne wedde hath none to legge
Necessitas Nede hathe no Lawe What liberti nede geueth . And he cauȝte in þat cas · & come þere-to by sleighte
Necessitas Nede hathe no Lawe What liberti nede geueth . He synneth nouȝte sothelich · þat so wynneth his fode
Necessitas Nede hathe no Lawe What liberti nede geueth . And þough he come so to a clothe · and can no better cheuysaunce
Necessitas Nede hathe no Lawe What liberti nede geueth . Nede anon-riȝte · nymeth hym vnder meynpryse
Necessitas Nede hathe no Lawe What liberti nede geueth . And if hym lyst for to lape · þe lawe of kynde wolde
Necessitas Nede hathe no Lawe What liberti nede geueth . That he dronke at eche diche · ar he for thurste deyde
Necessitas Nede hathe no Lawe What liberti nede geueth . So nede at grete nede · may nymen as for his owne
Necessitas Nede hathe no Lawe What liberti nede geueth . Wyth-oute conseille of conscience · or cardynale vertues
Necessitas Nede hathe no Lawe What liberti nede geueth . So þat he suwe & saue · spiritus temperancie

spiritusG21.23 ¶ For is no vertue by fer to spiritus temperancie
spiritusG21.23 Neither spiritus iusticie · ne spiritus fortitudinis
spiritusG21.23 Temperaunce is the chiefe vertue, For spiritus fortitudinis · forfaiteth ful oft
spiritusG21.23 Temperaunce is the chiefe vertue, He shal do more þan mesure · many tyme & ofte
spiritusG21.23 Temperaunce is the chiefe vertue, Passus vicessimusR20.1, italic hand noting what passus we're in when R resumes And bete men ouer bitter · and somme of hem to litel
spiritusG21.23 Temperaunce is the chiefe vertue, Passus vicessimusR20.1, italic hand noting what passus we're in when R resumes And greue men gretter · þan goode faith it wolde

¶ And spiritus iusticie ; shal iuggen wolhe nolhe
After þe kynges conseille · & þe comune lyke
And spiritus prudencie · in many a poynte shal faille
Of þat he weneth wolde falle · if his wytte ne were
wenyng is no wisdomR20.7, secretary hand Wenynge is no wysdome · ne wyse ymagynacioun
wenyng is no wisdomR20.7, secretary hand Homo proponit & deus disponit · & gouerneth alle good vertues
wenyng is no wisdomR20.7, secretary hand Ac nede is next hym · for anon he meketh
wenyng is no wisdomR20.7, secretary hand And as low as a lombe · for lakkyng of þat hym nedeth
wenyng is no wisdomR20.7, secretary hand Wyse men forsoke wele · for þey wolde be nedy
wenyng is no wisdomR20.7, secretary hand And woneden in wildernesse · & wolde nouȝte be riche

¶ And god al his grete ioye · gostliche he left
And cam & toke mankynde · and bycam nedy
So nedy he was as seyth þe boke · in many sondry places
Þat he seyde in his sorwe · on þe selue Rode
Bothe fox & foule · may fleighe to hole & crepe
And þe fisshe hath fyn · to flete with to reste
+L20.45 Þere nede hath ynome me · þat I mote nede abyde
+L20.45 And suffre sorwes ful sowre · þat shal to ioye tourne
+L20.45 For-þi be nouȝte abasshed · to byde and to be nedy
+L20.45 Syth he þat wrouȝte al þe worlde · was wilfullich nedy
+L20.45 Ne neuer none so nedy · ne pouerere deyde

¶ Whan nede had vndernome me þus · anon I felle aslepe
And mette ful merueillously · þat in mannes forme

AntechristusC2.20.52 ipsa papaG21.52. Glosses "antecryst". . Antecrist .O20.52 Ieronimus super illud Danielis . 12 . Beatus qui expectat & peruenit vsque ad dies . 1335 . Beatus inquit qui interfecto antichristo . dies supra numerum perfinitum . 45 . prestolatur quibus & dominus saluator in sua magestate venturus est>O20.53. In a column in the right margin, parallel to O20.53-60 (KD20.54-61). The passage is taken almost verbatim from Saint Jerome's commentary on Daniel 12.12. ipsa papaG21.54. Glosses "false." The addition is smudged and may have been added in the wrong place and then partially deleted. Who receyued Antichriste fyrste .Cr3.20.57 Nota howe G21.57 . Freres .O20.57, surrounded by the long Latin gloss beginning opposite KD20.54. FryersR20.32, secretary hand fallshedd G21.58 fyrst krept G21.59 In by the popeG21.60 and his flockG21.61 Defyed al falsenesse · and folke þat it vsed

FryersR20.32, secretary hand fallshedd G21.58 fyrst krept G21.59 In by the popeG21.60 and his flockG21.61 +L20.66 They cursed and her conseille · were it clerke or lewed

¶ Antecriste hadde thus sone · hundredes at his banere
And Pryde it bare · boldely aboute
With a lorde þat lyueth · after lykynge of body
That cam aȝein conscience · þat kepere was & gyoure
Ouer kynde crystene · and cardynale vertues

¶ I conseille quod conscience þo · cometh with me ȝe foles
In-to vnyte holy cherche · and holde we vs there
And crye we to kynde · þat he come & defende vs
Foles · fro þis fendes lymes · for Piers loue þe plowman
And crye we to alle þe comune / þat þei come to vnite
And þere abide and bikere · aȝein beliales children

¶ Kynd conscience þo herde · and cam out of þe planetes
And sent forth his foreioures feures and fluxes
Coughes and cardiacles · crampes and tothaches
Rewmes & radegoundes · and roynouse scalles
iij iiji viuasS20.82 Byles and bocches · and brennyng agues
iij iiji viuasS20.82 Frenesyes & foule yueles · forageres of kynde
iij iiji viuasS20.82 Hadde yprykked and prayed polles of peple
iij iiji viuasS20.82 Þat largelich a legioun · lese her lyf sone

¶ There was harrow and help · here cometh kynde
A greate signe of infidelityCr3.20.88 With deth þat is dredful · to vndone vs alle

¶ The lorde that lyued after lust · tho alowde cryde
After conforte a knyghte · to come and bere his banere
Alarme alarme quod þat lorde eche lyf kepe his owne

¶ And þanne mette þis men · ar mynstralles myȝte pipe
And ar heraudes of armes · hadden descreued lordes

¶ Elde þe hore · he was in þe vauntwarde
And bare þe banere bifor deth · by riȝte he it claymed
Kynde come after · with many kene sores
As pokkes and pestilences · and moche poeple shente ·
the maner of goddes visitatation.Cr3.20.98 So kynde þorw corupciouns · kulled ful manye

- C20.97 ¶ Deth cam dryuende after · and al to doust passhed
- C20.97 Kynges & Knyȝtes · kayseres and popes
- C20.97 Lered ne lewed · he let no man stonde
- C20.97 That he hitte euene · þat euere stired after
- C20.97 Many a louely lady · and lemmanes of knyghtes
- C20.97 Swouned and swelted · for sorwe of dethes dyntes

¶ Conscience of his curteisye · to kynde he bisouȝte
To cesse & suffre · and see where þei wolde
Leue pryde pryuely · and be parfite cristene

¶ And kynde cessed tho · to se þe peple amende
The maner of men when plages ceaseCr3.20.109 Fortune gan flateren thenne · þo fewe þat were alyue
The maner of men when plages ceaseCr3.20.109 And byhight hem longe lyf · and lecherye he sent
The maner of men when plages ceaseCr3.20.109 Amonges al manere men · wedded & vnwedded
The maner of men when plages ceaseCr3.20.109 And gadered a gret hoste · al agayne conscience

¶ This lecherye leyde on · with a laughyng chiere
And with pryue speche · and peynted wordes
And armed hym in ydelnesse · and in hiegh berynge
He bare a bowe in his hande · and manye blody arwes
Weren fethered with faire biheste · and many a false truthe
+L20.118 Wit his vntydy tales · he tened ful ofte
+L20.118 Conscience and his compaignye · of holicherche þe techeres

¶ Thanne cam coueityse · and caste how he myȝte
Ouercome conscience · and cardynal vertues
And armed hym in auaryce · and hungriliche lyued
His wepne was al wiles · to wynnen & to hyden
With glosynges and with gabbynges · he gyled þe peple
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 Symonye hym sent · to assaille conscience
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 And preched to þe peple · and prelates þei hem maden
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 To holden with antecryste · her temperaltes to saue
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 And come to þe kynges conseille · as a kene baroun
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 And kneled to conscience in courte afor hem alle
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 And gart gode feith flee · and fals to abide
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 And boldeliche bar adown · with many a briȝte noble
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 Moche of þe witte and wisdome · of westmynster halle
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 He iugged til a iustice · and iusted in his ere
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 And ouertilte al his treuthe · with take þis vp amendement
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 And to þe arches in haste · he ȝede anone after
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 And torned Ciuile in-to symonye · and sitthe he toke þe official
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 # the mantell off MyneverM20.137 For a mentel of menyuere · he made lele matrimonye
Couetise and Simony make prelates.Cr3.20.125 # the mantell off MyneverM20.137 Departen ar deth cam · & deuos shupte

¶ Allas quod conscience & cried þo · wolde criste of his grace
That coueityse were cristene · þat is so kene a fiȝter
And bolde and bidyng · while his bagge lasteth

¶ And þanne lowgh lyf · and leet dagge his clothes
And armed hym in haste · in harlotes wordes
And helde holynesse a iape · and hendenesse a wastour
And lete leute a cherle · and lyer a fre man ·
Conscience and conseille · he counted it a folye ·

¶ Thus relyed lyf · for a litel fortune
And pryked forth with pryde preyseth he no vertue
A careth nouȝte how kynde slow · and shal come atte laste
And culle alle erthely creature · saue conscience one
Lyf leep asyde · and lauȝte hym a lemman
Heel & I quod he · and hieghnesse of herte
Shal do þe nouȝte drede · noyther deth ne elde
Lyfe and Fortune beget Slouth.Cr3.20.154 And to forȝete sorwe · and ȝyue nouȝte of synne

¶ This lyked lyf · and his lemman fortune
And geten in her glorie · a gadelyng atte laste
One þat moche wo wrouȝte · sleuthe was his name
Sleuthe wex wonder ȝerne · and sone was of age
Slouthe marieth dispayreCr3.20.159 And wedded one wanhope · a wenche of þe stuwes
Slouthe marieth dispayreCr3.20.159 Her syre was a sysour · þat neure swore treuthe
Slouthe marieth dispayreCr3.20.159 # Tom twotongeM20.161 One Thomme two tonge · ateynte at vch a queste

¶ This sleuthe was war of werre · and a slynge made
mordonM20.163 And threwe drede of dyspayre · a dozein myle aboute
mordonM20.163 For care conscience þo · cryed vpon elde
mordonM20.163 And bad hym fonde to fyȝte · and afere wanhope

¶ And elde hent good hope · and hastilich he shifte hym
And wayued awey wanhope · and with lyf he fyȝteth
And lyf fleigh for fere to fysyke after helpe
And bisouȝte hym of socoure · and of his salue hadde
And gaf hym golde good woon · þat gladded his herte
And þei gyuen hym agayne a glasen houve
Lyf leued þat lechecrafte · lette shulde elde
# contra phisicosM20.173 And dryuen awey deth · with dyas and dragges

¶ And elde auntred hym on lyf · and atte laste he hitte
Age killeth boeth Phisician & SurgianCr3.20.175 A Fisicien with a forred hood · þat he fel in a palsye
Age killeth boeth Phisician & SurgianCr3.20.175 And þere deyed þat doctour · ar thre dayes after
Age killeth boeth Phisician & SurgianCr3.20.175 Now I see seyde lyf · þat surgerye ne Fisyke
Age killeth boeth Phisician & SurgianCr3.20.175 May nouȝte a myte auaille · to medle aȝein elde
Age killeth boeth Phisician & SurgianCr3.20.175 And in hope of his hele · gode herte he hente
Age killeth boeth Phisician & SurgianCr3.20.175 And rode so to reuel · a ryche place and a merye
Age killeth boeth Phisician & SurgianCr3.20.175 The companye of conforte · men cleped it sumtyme
Age killeth boeth Phisician & SurgianCr3.20.175 And elde anone after me · and ouer myne heed ȝede
Age killeth boeth Phisician & SurgianCr3.20.175 And made me balled bifore · and bare on þe croune
Age killeth boeth Phisician & SurgianCr3.20.175 So harde he ȝede ouer myn hed · it wil be seen eure

¶ Sire euel ytauȝte elde quod I · vnhende go with the
Sith whanne was þe way · ouer men hedes
XM20.187 Haddestow be hende quod I · þow woldest haue asked leue

¶ Ȝe leue lordeyne quod he · and leyde on me with age
And hitte me vnder þe ere · vnethe may ich here
He buffeted me aboute þe mouthe · & bett out my tethe
And gyued me in goutes · I may nouȝte go at large
notaR20.167 And of þe wo þat I was in · my wyf had reuthe
notaR20.167 And wisshed ful witterly · þat I were in heuene
notaR20.167 For þe lyme þat she loued me fore · and leef was to fele
notaR20.167 On nyȝtes namely · whan we naked were
notaR20.167 I ne myght in no manere · maken it at hir wille
notaR20.167 So elde and she sothly · hadden it forbeten

¶ And as I seet in þis sorwe · I say how kynde passed
And deth drowgh niegh me · for drede gan I quake
And cried to kynde · out of care me brynge
Loo elde þe hoore · hath me biseye
Awreke me if ȝowre wille be · for I wolde ben hennes

¶ Ȝif þow wilt ben ywroken · wende in-to vnite
And holde þe þere eure · tyl I sende for þe
And loke þow conne somme crafte ar þow come þennes
Nature wolde we shoulde kearne to loue.Cr3.20.206 Conseille me kynde quod I · what crafte is best to lerne
Nature wolde we shoulde kearne to loue.Cr3.20.206 loveR20.182, secretary hand Lerne to loue quod kynde · & leue of alle othre

¶ How shal I come to catel so · to clothe me and to fede
And þow loue lelly quod he · lakke shal þe neure
Mete ne wordly wede · whil þi lyf lasteth

¶ And þere by conseille of kynde · I comsed to rowme
theS20.209 Thorw contricioun & confessioun · tyl I cam to vnite
theS20.209 And þere was conscience constable · cristene to saue
theS20.209 The seu capitall sinnes besieged conscience.Cr3.20.214 And biseged sothly · with seuene grete gyauntz
theS20.209 The seu capitall sinnes besieged conscience.Cr3.20.214 Þat with Antecrist helden · hard aȝein conscience

¶ Sleuth with his slynge · an hard saut he made
Proude prestes come with hym moo þan a thousand
In paltokes & pyked shoes · & pisseres longe knyues
Comen aȝein conscience · with coueityse þei helden

# the prest off IrlondM20.220 Woulde god there were no such priestes in englande.Cr3.20.221 I counte namore conscience · bi so I cacche syluer

¶ Conscience cryed helpe · clergye or ellis I falle
Thorw inparfit prestes · and prelates of holicherche
bene vales conscienciaM20.229 Freres herden hym crye · and comen hym to helpe
bene vales conscienciaM20.229 Ac for þei couth nouȝte wel her craft · conscience forsoke hem

¶ Nede neghed tho nere · and conscience he tolde

The first of these additions appears in the extreme left margin, the other in the left margin just opposite the line. Lat hem be as beggeres · or lyue by angeles fode

¶ Conscience of þis conseille þo · comsed for to laughe
+L20.242 And curtei[s]lich conforted hem · and called in alle freres
+L20.242 And seide sires sothly · welcome be ȝe alle
+L20.242 To vnite and holicherche · ac on thyng I ȝow preye
+L20.242 Holdeth ȝow in vnyte · and haueth none envye
+L20.242 To lered ne to lewed · but lyueth after ȝowre rewle
+L20.242 And I wil be ȝowre borghe · ȝe shal haue bred and clothes
+L20.242 And other necessaries anowe · ȝow shal no thyng faille
+L20.242 With þat ȝe leue logyk · and lerneth for to louye
+L20.242 - C20.248 For loue laft þei lordship · bothe londe and scole
+L20.242 - C20.248 Frere Fraunceys and Dominyk · for loue to ben holy

¶ And if ȝe coueyteth cure · kynde wil ȝow teche
That in mesure god made · alle manere thynges
And sette it at a certeyne · and at a syker noumbre
And nempned names newe · and noumbred þe sterres
[Pointing hand]C20.254 Qui numerat multitudinem stellarum · & omnibus eis &c

notaY20.255 ¶ Kynges & knyghtes þat kepen and defenden
notaY20.255 Han officers vnder hem · and vch of hem certeyne
notaY20.255 And if þei wage men to werre · þei write hem in noumbre
notaY20.255 Wil no tresorere hem paye · trauaille þei neure so sore
notaY20.255 Alle other in bataille · ben yholde bribours
notaY20.255 Pilours and pykehernois · in eche a place ycursed

¶ Monkes and monyals · and alle men of Religioun
Her ordre and her reule wil · to han a certeyne noumbre
Of lewed and of lered · þe lawe wol and axeth
A certeyn for a certeyne · saue onelich of freres
The Fryers are with out numbreCr3.20.266 For-þi quod conscience by cryst · kynde witte me telleth
The Fryers are with out numbreCr3.20.266 It is wikked to wage ȝow · ȝe wexeth out of noumbre
The Fryers are with out numbreCr3.20.266 Heuene hath euene noumbre · and helle is with-out noumbre
The Fryers are with out numbreCr3.20.266 For-þi I wolde witterly · þat ȝe were in þe Registre
The Fryers are with out numbreCr3.20.266 And ȝowre noumbre vndre notarie sygne · & noyther mo ne lasse

¶ Enuye herd þis · and heet freres to go to scole
And lerne logyk and lawe · and eke contemplacioun
And preche men of plato · and preue it by seneca
Þat alle þinges vnder heuene · ouȝte to ben in comune

¶ And ȝit he lyeth as I leue · þat to þe lewed so precheth

¶ Ac whil he is in westmynstre · he wil be bifore
And make hym merye with other mennes goodis
And so it fareth with moche folke · þat to þe freres shryueth

¶ Enuye herfore · hated conscience
And freres to philosofye · he fonde hem to scole
X The while coueytise and vnkyndenesse · conscience assailled
X In vnite holycherche · conscience helde hym
X And made pees porter · to pynne þe ȝates
X Of alle taletellers · and tyterers in ydel

X ItDR20.273 . ypocrisie .O20.299 DvdR20.275 Hipocrisi woundeth preachersCr3.20.302 . schrifte .O20.304 For her mysdedes þat þei wrouȝte hadden
X ItDR20.273 . ypocrisie .O20.299 DvdR20.275 Hipocrisi woundeth preachersCr3.20.302 . schrifte .O20.304 And þat piers were payed · redde quod debes

¶ Somme lyked nouȝte þis leche · and lettres þei sent
Ȝif any surgien were þe sege · þat softer couth plastre
# syr leff to live in lecherye Sire lief to lyue in leccherye · lay þere and groned
# syr leff to live in lecherye For fastyng of a fryday · he ferde as he wolde deye
# syr leff to live in lecherye Ther is a surgiene in þis sege · þat soft can handle
# syr leff to live in lecherye ffrere fflatererC2.20.313 And more of phisyke bi fer · and fairer he plastreth
# syr leff to live in lecherye ffrere fflatererC2.20.313 nota nota . Frere flaterer .O20.313 One frere flaterere is phisiciene and surgiene
# syr leff to live in lecherye ffrere fflatererC2.20.313 nota nota . Frere flaterer .O20.313 · c · Quod contricioun to conscience · do hym come to vnyte
# syr leff to live in lecherye ffrere fflatererC2.20.313 nota nota . Frere flaterer .O20.313 · c · For here is many a man herte · þorw ypocrisie

¶ We han no nede quod conscience · I wote no better leche
Than persoun or parissh prest · penytancere or bisshop ·
.id est. papa Saue Piers þe plowman · þat hath powere ouer hem alle
.id est. papa And indulgence may do · but if dette lette it
.id est. papa I may wel suffre seyde conscience · syn ȝe desiren
.id est. papa That frere flaterer be fette · and phisike ȝow syke

¶ The Frere her-of herde · and hyed faste
Nother patron nor bishop, regardeth his dutyeCr3.20.324 To a lorde for a lettre · leue to haue to curen
Nother patron nor bishop, regardeth his dutyeCr3.20.324 As a curatour he were · and cam with his lettres
Nother patron nor bishop, regardeth his dutyeCr3.20.324 Baldly to þe bisshop · & his brief hadde
Nother patron nor bishop, regardeth his dutyeCr3.20.324 In contrees þere he come in · confessiouns to here
Nother patron nor bishop, regardeth his dutyeCr3.20.324 And cam þere conscience was · and knokked atte ȝate

¶ Pees vnpynned it · was porter of vnyte
And in haste asked · what his wille were
In faith quod þis frere · for profit and for helthe
Carpe I wolde with contricioun · & þerfore come I hider

¶ He is sike seide pees · and so ar many other
Ypocrisie hath herte hem · ful harde is if þei keure
I am a surgien seide þe segge · and salues can make
Conscience knoweth me wel · and what I can do bothe
. Frere leche .O20.336 I preye þe quod pees þo · ar þow passe ferther
. Frere leche .O20.336 What hattestow I preye þe · hele nouȝte þi name

penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 ¶ Certes seyde his felow sire penetrans domos
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 Ȝe go þi gate quod pees · bi god for al þi phisyk
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 But þow conne somme crafte · þow comest nouȝt her-Inne
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 I knewe such one ones · nouȝte eighte wynter passed
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 Come in þus ycoped · at a courte þere I dwelt
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 And was my lordes leche · & my ladyes bothe
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 And at þe last þis limitour · þo my lorde was out
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 He salued so owre wommen · til somme were with childe
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 Hende speche het pees · opene þe ȝates
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 Late in þe frere and his felawe · and make hem faire chere
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 He may se and here · so it may bifalle
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 That lyf þorw his lore shal leue coueityse
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 And be adradde of deth · and with-drawe hym fram pryde
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 And acorde with conscience · and kisse her either other
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 Thus thorw hende speche entred þe frere
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 And cam in-to conscience · and curteisly hym grette
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 Þow art welcome quod conscience canstow hele þe syke
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 Here is contricioun quod conscience · my cosyn ywounded
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 Conforte hym quod conscience and take kepe to his sores
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 The plastres of þe persoun · and poudres biten to sore
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 He lat hem ligge ouerlonge · and loth is to chaunge hem
penetrans domosR20.313, 15th century hand [probably by more than one hand, some of it cropped, partial erasure.]S20.335 Fro lenten to lenten · he lat his plastres bite

. Frere confessour .O20.360, flourish centered beneath. ¶ That is ouerlonge quod this limitour · I leue I shal amende it
. Frere confessour .O20.360, flourish centered beneath. And goth and gropeth contricioun · and gaf hym a plastre
. Frere confessour .O20.360, flourish centered beneath. Of a pryue payement · and I shal praye for ȝow
. Frere confessour .O20.360, flourish centered beneath. The olde maner of cares shrifte made synners negligentCr3.20.364 For alle þat ȝe ben holde to · al my lyf-tyme
. Frere confessour .O20.360, flourish centered beneath. The olde maner of cares shrifte made synners negligentCr3.20.364 And make ȝow my lady · in masse and in matynes
. Frere confessour .O20.360, flourish centered beneath. The olde maner of cares shrifte made synners negligentCr3.20.364 As freres of owre fraternite · for a litel syluer

¶ Thus he goth and gadereth · and gloseth þere he shryueth
Tyl contricioun hadde clene forȝeten · to crye & to wepe
And wake for his wykked werkes · as he was wont to done
For confort of his confessour · contricioun he lafte
contricionR20.345, 15th century hand Þat is þe souereynest salue · for alkyn synnes

¶ Sleuth seigh þat · and so did pryde
And come with a kene wille · conscience to assaille
Conscience cryde eft · and bad clergye help hym
And also contricioun · forto kepe þe ȝate
He lith and dremeth · seyde pees · and so do many other
The Frere with his phisik · þis folke hath enchaunted
And plastred hem so esyly · þei drede no synne

¶ Bi cryste quod conscience þo · I wil bicome a pilgryme
And walken as wyde · as al þe wordle lasteth
XF16.380, drypoint noting omission of next line To seke Piers þe plowman · þat pryde may destruye
XF16.380, drypoint noting omission of next line And þat freres hadde a fyndyng · þat for nede flateren
XF16.380, drypoint noting omission of next line - And contrepleteth me conscience · now kynde me auenge
XF16.380, drypoint noting omission of next line - And sende me happe and hele · til I haue piers þe plowman
XF16.380, drypoint noting omission of next line - And siththeR20.359, modern pencil, to clarify unclear main text And sitthe he gradde after grace · til I gan awake

Explicit hic dialogus petri plowman
